TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Established on the basis of a written consitution which sets out the party aims and the signatures of 500 party members who are on the electoral roll and are not members of any other party
A5RECPPGTXT: Established on the basis of a written consitution which sets out the party aims and have at least one sitting member in the Australian Commonwealth Parliament
A81CONDELTXT: National Conference consists of 400 delegates comprising delegates elected from the federal parliamentary par
A110EXPELTXT: Bringing the Party into disrepute; action or conduct contrary to the principles and solidarity of the Party; disloyal or unworthy conduct; disruptive-tactics; making public statements about internal Party matters which may harm the best interests of the Party; not supporting the Platform (policies) and Rules of the Party to the best of the member’s ability; or failing to vote and work for officially selected Party candidates.
B2BALLOTTXT: 18 years of age or older, an Australian citizen, and entitled to vote at a House of Representatives election. Subject to Section 44 of the  Consitution, which covers disqualification for: a member of a State or Territory parliament, unless they have resigned before lodging a nomination; a citizen or subject of a foreign power; serving a prison sentence of 12 months or more; is an undischarged bankrupt or insolvent; holding an office of profit under the Crown (e.g. Public Servant); or a permanent member of the Australian Defence Force.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A nomination form must be provided by the candidate, or by their Party on the candidates behalf, to the Australian Electoral Commission, including contact detials; verification of endorsement for endorsed candidates and an indication of whether the party's full name or abbreviation is to be printed adjacent to the candidate's name and whether the party's registered logo is to be included on the ballot paper; for unendorsed candidates, nomination by 100 electors of the relevant division, and an indication whether the word 'Independent' is to be printed adjacent to the candidate's name; and a declaration by the candidate that they are constitutionally and legally qualified to be elected, have not nominated for another election to be held on the same day, and are prepared to act if elected.
B18CANWOMTXT: Minimum percentage (40%) of the candidates preselected for each of the following groups of seats must be women: (i) the seats currently held by the ALP, (ii) the seats that would be won by the ALP with a 5% increase in its two party preferred vote since the last election (“winnable seats”), and (iii) all other seats to be preselected.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates to the Senate (Upper House) are selected by the State Conference and the State Administrative Committee. Candidates to the House of Representatives (Lower House) are selected by party members voting in their electorates or the Administrative Committee. Unions/the National Executive and the Party Leader have reputedly had some influence in this process at various elections, but none of these bodies/offices have a formal constitutional role in the process.
C9LDRTITLE: Leader of the Federal Parliamentary Labor Party (FPLP)
C21BPLTITLE: Leader of the Federal Parliamentary Labor Party (FPLP)
C46PLSELTXT: The Leader must be elected by: (i) a ballot of eligible Party members, and (ii) a ballot of the members of the FPLP, where the results of each ballot are given equal weighting and added together.

A81CONDELTXT: No rules
A91EXCWOMTXT: The President of the Federal Women’s Committee is one of the members of the Federal Executive.
A110EXPELTXT: Suspension: (1) Unsatisfactory conduct as a Member includes conduct either by an act or omission, which involves conduct which falls short of the standard of conduct that a Member of the Division is entitled to expect from a reasonable Member; (2) Misconduct as a Member includes conduct either by an act or omission, which involves a substantial or consistent failure to reach a reasonable standard of conduct as a Member; (3) A breach of a mandatory code of conduct may be either unsatisfactory conduct or misconduct. Expulsion: (1) If a Member becomes a member of a Proscribed Organisation; (2) If a member not endorsed by the Organisation claims to be an endorsed candidate for election; (3) If a candidate standing for public office without written permission of the State Executive associates the Party in any way with that candidacy; (4) Any member who actively assists a candidate other than the candidate endorsed by the Party for Federal, State or Local election where there is a candidate endorsed by the Party; (5) Admission or conviction of a serious criminal offence; (6) Breach of the Party's Media, FInance or Ethics Madatory Codes of Practice or Rules, as determined by the State Director.
B2BALLOTTXT: 18 years of age or older, an Australian citizen, and entitled to vote at a House of Representatives election. B18CANWOMTXT: State Executive will determine a target proportion of candidates who shall be female
B28CANSELTXT: Members nominate. Nomination Review COmmittee formed to consider nominations. Includes Division President or their representative, Federal Parliamentary Leader or their representative and State Director or State Director nominee.
C46PLSELTXT: No written rules at the time of this leadership change. However, sitting Party Leader Malcolm Turnbull required a letter signed by at least 43 members of the party room before a spill would be called.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: ART.11 of internal rules of the House of representatives: to be recognized as legislative party group, parties have to have a minimum of 5 members.
A5RECPPGTXT: To be recognized as parties (for public funding): need to create an association of natural persons, with or without legal personality, that participates in elections as planned in the Constitution and that ‘attempts to influence the will of the people in accordance with its statutes or its program’. Furthermore, the party needs to be represented either in the House of Representatives or in the Senate by at least 1 directly elected representative.
A81CONDELTXT: Open to all members
A110EXPELTXT: Serious violation of the internal rules of the party, of respect for the authority of the decision-making bodies formally identified in the statutes or of ordinary law.
B2BALLOTTXT: Party shall present lists of candidates in each of the district in which they want to run. These lists composed of full candidates (running for direct election) and of substitute candidates (who would only sit in parliament in case a full candidate resign). In each district, the minimum number of full candidates is 1 and the maximum number equals district magnitude. For the substitute candidates, there is a fixed number of candidates equals to half the number of full candidates (with a minimum of six substitute candidates in districts where DM < 12). Lists shall be endorsed by either three incumbent MPs or by a certain number of voters. The number of signatures required equals 200 in district comprising less than 500,000 inhabitants, 400 in districts between 500,000 and 1 million inhabitants and 500 in districts with more than 1 million inhabitants.
B4CANLAW2TXT: List shall be composed of half male and half female candidates, with a maximum difference of one for odd lists. Moreover, the first two positions on the list shall be occupied by a male and a female candidate, in the order determined by the party.
C46PLSELTXT: Right to vote: universal suffrage for party members.

A special committee composed of the Leader of the party, the leader of the governmental group and members of the executives "shall ensure that procedures are properly followed and that there is a balance between the components of the movement." In fact, it appears that this special committee, accompanied by the president of the party's research centre, has a preponderant role in the composition of the lists.

A91EXCWOMTXT: At least 1/4 of the Bureau must be composed of women
A110EXPELTXT:
The chairman of the party shall have the right of evocation. This means that he can intervene preventively in urgent cases where the interest and functioning of the party at local, provincial or national level are threatened.
To this end, the chairperson will first obtain thorough information on the situation.
If there is no unanimous agreement on the intervention of the chairman of the party, this dispute will immediately be placed on the agenda of the Administrative Commission.
In the case of listing, the dispute shall exceptionally be placed on the agenda of the party bureau.
B2BALLOTTXT: Party shall present lists of candidates in each of the district in which they want to run. These lists composed of full candidates (running for direct election) and of substitute candidates (who would only sit in parliament in case a full candidate resign). In each district, the minimum number of full candidates is 1 and the maximum number equals district magnitude. For the substitute candidates, there is a fixed number of candidates equals to half the number of full candidates (with a minimum of six substitute candidates in districts where DM < 12). Lists shall be endorsed by either three incumbent MPs or by a certain number of voters. The number of signatures required equals 200 in district comprising less than 500,000 inhabitants, 400 in districts between 500,000 and 1 million inhabitants and 500 in districts with more than 1 million inhabitants.
B4CANLAW2TXT: List shall be composed of half male and half female candidates, with a maximum difference of one for odd lists. Moreover, the first two positions on the list shall be occupied by a male and a female candidate, in the order determined by the party.
B18CANWOMTXT: Gender quota in electoral rules, but statutes specifically mention that the party has to ensure parity on its lists
C46PLSELTXT: Right to vote: universal suffrage for party members.

C46PLSELTXT: The selection of the leader is a two-step process emphasizing the dominant role of the party executive. The first step of the process corresponds to the designation of the candidate. All members of the party executive can apply, and the selection of the candidate is made by a secret vote of the party executive. The candidate who wins a majority of the votes after the first round is proposed to the congress as candidate-leader. If no candidate reaches a majority of the votes, a second round is organized, with only the top-two candidates of the first round. In the second step of the process, the candidate-leader is presented to the party congress, where all members with voting rights are invited to vote (Members are granted the right to vote after one year of party affiliation). If the candidate does not reach a majority of the votes, the party executive has to propose an alternative candidate, under the exact same procedure.

B28CANSELTXT: At the constituency level, all members analyze candidacies for all eligible places on the list one by one, and vote in Assembly (quorum of at least 20% of members required); Initiative, formal input (amendements) and formal approval: The constituency organization analyzes candidacies for all eligible places on the list, and votes via membership vote ((quorum of at least 20% of members required); Formal input: The 'conseil de fédération' can adopt a procedure to co-decide on the lists for all elections
C46PLSELTXT: Members have the right to vote: universal suffrage for party members at the party congress.; The ‘Conseil de fédération’ (composed of regional delegates, parliamentarians and coopted delegates) has the right to determine the process and modalities of the selection of the party leader, with the exception that the election must occur via universal suffrage of party members; In case of the resignation or dismissal of one of the co-presidents, the remaining one has to suggest a leadership candidate to the "Conseil de Fédération". At this moment, it belongs to the "Conseil de Fédération" to vote by an absolute majority of vote for the designated substitute. This last rule changed in the new statutes of 2016

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Minimum of 3 Czech citizens older than 18 can form a preparatory committee; they can be members of only one political party at a time. They need to submit an official proposal for establishing a new party signed by all members of the preparatory committee.
A5RECPPGTXT: At least 10 MPs are needed to form a Legislative Party Group.If the number decreases below minimum, the group will be dissolved.An MP can only be a member of one group at a time.Party needs constitutive document, including signatures and list naming members.
A55OTHERTXT: Zahranicni region CSSD, Svaz delnickych telovychovnych jednot, Masarykova demokraticka akademie
A79CONWOMTXT: At least 25 % of delegates must be women, if possible
A81CONDELTXT: Minimum 2/3 of delegates with advisory votes should be elected from delegates on lower posts.  Chairpersons of local organizations, if not members of higher organizations, are counted as part of these 2/3 of delegates from lower levels.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Reserved seat for the chairperson of Women's sub organization, and Senior sub organizations, but they have only advisory votes.
A110EXPELTXT: Accepting candidature on different party list wihout the party’s knowledge. Not paying party fees. Serious breach of the program and the statutes of the party. Long-term absence from the party's activities. Found guilty of criminal offence. Repeated breach of resolutions of Central Executeve Commitee or Conference.
B2BALLOTTXT: Political party has to submit a candidate list to the District office in the voting region, which has to contain the name of the political party, the name, age, occupation and address of the candidates, as well as the order of the candidates on the list. The list has to be submited at least 66 days before the election date. Furthermore, particular information about the candidates and their agreement with the nomination must be included.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A candidate may be any citizen of the Czech Republic who is at least 21 years old on the second day of the elections, if there are no obstacles in carrying out the voter right (i.e the capacity to carry out legal actions is not limited)
B18CANWOMTXT: No less than 40% of candidates have to be selected from one gender group
B28CANSELTXT: The candidates are selected by the members and the party organs by primary election. The rules of primaries are provided by the Central Executive Committee. Gender quota (40%) is applied.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Candidate can be included if supported by signature of 20 MPs or 10 senators.
C46PLSELTXT: Party leader is selected by the Congress. Central Executive Committee has right to decide on the direct election of leader by party members.
C87ELSELTXT: Regional leaders are selected in primaries by party members in respective constituencies. The right to suggest candidates have Political Gremium, Regional Executive Committee, Two Counties Executive Committees, 1/10 of local organizations within one regional organization, 1/10 of members of one regional organization.

B3CANLAW1TXT: A candidate may be any citizen of the Czech Republic who is at least 21 years old on the second day of the elections, if there are no obstacles in carrying out the voter right (i.e the capacity to carry out legal actions is not limited)
B18CANWOMTXT: At least one woman within first three places on the list
B28CANSELTXT: The candidates are selected by the members and the party organs by primary election. The rules of primaries are provided by the Central Committee.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Candidate can be included if supported by signature of 20 MPs or 10 senators.
BPRESSELTXT: No rules
C46PLSELTXT: Congress elects party collective leadership.
C87ELSELTXT: Regional committee consults with the Central Committee of KSČM a proposal for a leading candidate

TITLE: on the candidate list at the level of region
Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Minimum of 3 Czech citizens older than 18 can form a preparatory committee; they can be members of only one political party at a time. They need to submit an official proposal for establishing a new party signed by all members of the preparatory committee.
A5RECPPGTXT: At least 10 MPs are needed to form a Legislative Party Group.If the number decreases below minimum, the group will be dissolved.An MP can only be a member of one group at a time.Party needs constitutive document, including signatures and list naming members.
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
A110EXPELTXT: Accepting candidature on different party list wihout the party’s knowledge, not paying party fees, discovery that the member was infact party of the militia or Secret Communist police
B2BALLOTTXT: Political party has to submit a candidate list to the District office in the voting region, which has to contain the name of the political party, the name, age, occupation and address of the candidates, as well as the order of the candidates on the list. The list has to be submited at least 66 days before the election date. Furthermore, particular information about the candidates and their agreement with the nomination must be included.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A candidate may be any citizen of the Czech Republic who is at least 21 years old on the second day of the elections, if there are no obstacles in carrying out the voter right (i.e the capacity to carry out legal actions is not limited)
B28CANSELTXT: The candidates are selected by the members and the party organs. The order is selected according to party primaries. The lists are put together by the national committee according to the primaries. If the national committee wants to make changes agaist the primaries’ this needs to be explained and consulted with the regional committee. The exact rules of primaries are set by the party national conference
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Candidate can be included if supported by signature of 20 MPs or 10 senators.
BPRESSELTXT: The candidates are nominated by members and party organisations and selected through party primaries
C46PLSELTXT: the leader is selected during the party conference. More rules not provided within the statues
C87ELSELTXT: Regional organisations suggest candidates for the top tier party roles. The national party meeting (Sjezd) then votes on the party leader, as well as other high party possitions.

TITLE: Political Party Database
