A5RECPPGTXT: At least 10 MPs are needed to form a Legislative Party Group.If the number decreases below minimum, the group will be dissolved.An MP can only be a member of one group at a time.Party needs constitutive document, including signatures and list naming members.
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
A110EXPELTXT: Becomimg member of different party, being candidate of different party without prior approval, in the event of one´s death, deprivation of legal capacity, dissolution of local organization where member is registered
B2BALLOTTXT: Political party has to submit a candidate list to the District office in the voting region, which has to contain the name of the political party, the name, age, occupation and address of the candidates, as well as the order of the candidates on the list. The list has to be submited at least 66 days before the election date. Furthermore, particular information about the candidates and their agreement with the nomination must be included.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A candidate may be any citizen of the Czech Republic who is at least 21 years old on the second day of the elections, if there are no obstacles in carrying out the voter right (i.e the capacity to carry out legal actions is not limited)
B28CANSELTXT: Regional organizations create candidates lists, national executive decides on the final form of candidate lists and party leader has possibility to change candidate lists anytime after they have been finalised by national executive.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Candidate can be included if supported by signature of 20 MPs or 10 senators.
C46PLSELTXT: Party Congress elects and calls off party leader.
C87ELSELTXT: Regional organizations propose candidates for lists, National executive selects all candidates to national legislative elections, party leader can however make any change to final versions of candidate lists and veto candidates. For elections to lower level of political representation it is regional and local executives that propose and select candidates for the respective candidate list at their level.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: There is no fixed total amount for the number of congress delegates. The overall amount of congress delegates is dependent on the amount of sub-organizations and, more importantly, the number of members within them. Each branch party gets to send one delegate for every 50 members. Each municipal association gets to send, first, three delegates and then one delegate per every 50 members. Each municipal organization gets to send three delegates. Every district (=regional) organization gets to send 4 delegates per every 5000 members. Women, youth and students organizations and other nation-wide central organizations can send 2 delegates per every 5000 members.
A91EXCWOMTXT: At least 40% of the members of the party's national executive must be women.
A92EXCETHTXT: The Swedish-speaking sub-organization has the rights of a district/regional party and thus it will get automatically represented in the highest executive body.
A110EXPELTXT: A member whose actions 1) raise general resentment, 2) go against the party manifesto or decision-making organs' decisions or 3) causes significant harm to the party can be expelled from the branch with the decision of its board.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: A group of 15 party members from the same party branch or a group of 30 party members from different branches can propose a candidate. A party branch/local party and a district (=regional) party can propose candidates, too. If there are more proposed candidates than the party can nominate in the electoral district, the final list of candidates is decided in a vote among party members that reside in the electoral district. After the vote, the district (=regional) party congress or executive officially nominates the candidates. It can change 1/3 of the candidates that were selected in the vote.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: According to the statutes, the national party executive proposes a presidential candidate for the party congress, which makes the official nomination. However, the statutes also state that an advisory primary can be held according to the special rules set by the party council. For this specific contest (2018) the vote could have been arranged among party members (and, depending on the party council's decision, non-members, too) and a group of ten (10) or more local organizations or a district (=regional) party could propose a presidential candidate. After the primary, if one is being held, the party congress still makes the official nomination.
C46PLSELTXT: The party chair is selected in the party congress, where only eligible congress delegates have the right to propose candidates and vote. However, if the national executive decides, there can be an advisory membership vote before the congress, where every at least 15 year-old member of a local branch is eligible to vote. In order to be an eligible candidate, one needs to have the backing of at least 10 party branches or one district (=regional) party. The final decision still lies in the party congress. Membership vote on party leader's position has never occurred in the Centre party.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: The party does not utilize the delegate model in its congressess. Instead, every individual party member and party's organizational member has full rights (i.e. is allowed to vote) in the party congress. The party's organizational members are district (=regional) parties and they are represented by their chair persons.
A91EXCWOMTXT: At least one of the party's three deputy chairs has to be a woman and at least one has to be a man.
A110EXPELTXT: A member has not paid their membership fees, a member has not fulfilled the commitments they agreed when they joined the party, a member is also a member of another Finnish party, a member has agreed to be on the election list of another party or constituency association, a member has parted from the municipal council group of the party, a member has harmed the party through their actions, or a member has not fulfilled the conditions the party has mandated for members in party statutes.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: Party's candidates for the parliamentary elections are set at the district (=regional) organizations, according to the results of a district-wide membership vote. A group of 10 party members, a local organization (branch party) and a regional organization (a district party) can propose candidates for the membership vote. Within the limits set by the law (see B3CANLAW1TXT), and by the permission of the national executive, the district congress can diverge from the result of the vote.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The national executive proposes a candidate for the presidential election, and the party congress or the party council nominates him/her or decides whether the party supports another candidate. All of the party's individual members can vote in the party congress.
C46PLSELTXT: Party chair is selected in the party congress, but in the Finns every party member has full rights of a congress delegate (i.e. he/she is allowed to vote) and therefore the vote can be regarded as a binding membership ballot. Thus, the Finns model is the clearest (Finnish) example of a leadership selection procedure where the ordinary members have a direct influence over the end result.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: There is no fixed total amount for the number of congress delegates. The overall amount of congress delegates is dependent on the amount of sub-organizations and, more importantly, the amount of members within them. Each district (=regional) organization gets to send one delegate and then one delegate for every 30 members. The district (=regional) organization can make special rules for allocating its share of delegates to its constituent parts (branches, etc.). If no further rules exist, the seats are allocated evenly between the branch parties that are part of the regional party. Each nation-wide special organization gets to send one delegate and then one delegate for every 30 members. The regional sub-organizations of the special organization get to send one delegate and then one delegate for every 30 members. Other regional and municipal organizations get to send one delegate.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: The candidates for the parliamentary election can be nominated by local organizations (party branches), a group of 10 party members from the same branch or a group of 20 party members from different branches (that are located in the same electoral district). If more candidates are proposed than what the party can nominate in the electoral district, a vote must be held among the members of the district. If there is no need to hold a vote, the nomination is done by district (=regional) congress or council, unless one of them delegates the decision to the district executive. If there is a vote, the district (=regional) congress can change 1/4 of the nominated candidates after it with the permission from the national party executive. They cannot, however, change the half that did best in the membership vote.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The party's presidential candidate is nominated in the party congress. An advisory primary can be held before the congress, although it does not bind the congress' decision. The national party executive decides how the vote is organized.
C46PLSELTXT: The party chair is elected in the party congress. Every eligible congress delegate has the right to propose a candidate and vote. If no candidate gets a majority of the votes in the first round, a runoff is organized between the two candidates who got most votes in the first round.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A80CONETHTXT: The Swedish speaking Social Democratic sub-organisation has the same status as regional/state parties, which choose the delegates for party congresses. That is why the Swedish speaking Social Democrats enjoy a mandatory representation at party congresses.
A81CONDELTXT: A total of 500 delegates have full rights at the party congress. This amount is allocated between district (=regional) parties according to their aggregate membership (the sum of all branch party members within a district). The number of delegates per district is counted by, first, summing together all eligible members (i.e. individual members that have paid their fee for the ongoing year or are officially freed from membership fee) of the branch parties, which are situated in the same district. Then, the number of members is multiplied by 500 and divided by the amount of the party's all eligible members. Finally, the district (=regional) party holds a vote among its eligible members to decide who are selected as party congress delegates.
A91EXCWOMTXT: At least 40% of the members of party's highest executive body must be women.
A92EXCETHTXT: At least one member of the party's highest executive body must be selected from a Swedish speaking branch party.
A110EXPELTXT: Individual 1) is a member of some other party, 2) agrees to compete in elections on other party's ticket 3) otherwise opposes national or lower levels of the party or harms the activities of branch, municipal, regional or national party.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates for parliamentary elections are selected in electoral districts where the party is represented by a district (=regional) sub-organization. Its constituent branch parties and groups of at least five party members can propose candidates. If more candidates have been proposed than what the party may nominate in the district (the maximum number of candidates a party may nominate in a district is the amount of parliamentary seats that are chosen within a district), the final set of candidates is selected in a vote among party members of the electoral district. After it, the district party can change 1/4 of the total number of candidates that the party can nominate in the electoral district.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The national party council (the party's highest decision-making unit between party congresses) nominates a presidential candidate unless it decides to delegate the decision to party congress. A primary can occur before the official nomination. A group of a minimum of 250 party members that are entitled to vote in presidential election can propose a presidential candidate. A group of ten (10) local party branches may propose a candidate, too. If more than one candidate is proposed, a primary will be held among party members. The party council can decide to let non-member registered supporters that are entitled to vote in national elections to vote, too, but the vote must be organized in a way that it still highlights the will of the members. If the nomination is decided by vote, the will of the party members must be respected in the nomination of the candidate.
C46PLSELTXT: The party chair is elected at the party congress by eligible congress delegates. If there are more than two candidates for the position, the vote is organized as a ballot. If one of the candidates gets over 50% of the votes, he/she wins. If no one gets over 50% of the votes in the first round, a runoff is organized between the two candidates that gained most votes in the first round. The candidate who gets more votes in the second round wins.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: A total of 400 delegates have full rights at a party congress. The delegates are allocated between the district (=regional) parties, non-territorial sub-organizations (women, youth) and other official sub-organizations. First, every sub-organization gets one delegate and the sum of these delegates is deducted from the 400. The remaining part is allocated for the sub-organizations according to the number of their members that have paid the membership fee. If a district organization is left with fewer than 6 seats, the total number of delegates is increased up to the point that every district has at least 6 delegates. Within sub-organizations, 1/5 of the seats are allocated evenly for all of their constituent sub-organizations (party branches, etc.) and 4/5 according to the amount of their membership.
A91EXCWOMTXT: There must be at least five women in the party's highest executive.
A110EXPELTXT: A branch party must expel an individual party member if the member 1) is a member of another party or 2) runs as a candidate in other party's ballot in elections.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates for parliamentary elections are selected in the electoral district level. Every sub-organization in the electoral district has a right to propose candidates for party's internal consideration. Every sub-organization can propose the amount of candidates that the party can nominate in the electoral district (i.e. the amount of filled parliamentary seats). The national party executive can propose a group of candidates that equals 1/10 of the number of candidates that the party can nominate in the district. Also, a group of at least 15 party's members in the electoral district organization can propose a candidate. 3/4 of the candidates are selected in a membership vote at the district level. The district (=regional) congress or executive nominate the remaining 1/4 and it may also change a portion of the candidates that were selected in the membership vote (an amount that equals 1/4 of the total number that the party may nominate in the district), but the ones that are changed cannot belong to the half that got most votes in the membership vote.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The party council decides whether the party participates in the presidential election. The council also nominates the presidential candidate. It may also delegate these decisions to the party congress.
C46PLSELTXT: The national executive can call an advisory membership vote on party leader's position before the party congress, which makes the final official decision. The party has decided on a principle that it holds membership vote about the party chair before the party congress; the party congress merely "rubber stamps" the decision. In order for the advisory membership vote to be effective, at least half of the party members must participate in it. District (=regional) parties, nation-wide league organizations (liittojärjestö) and at least two other member organizations whose combined amount of members is more than 50 can propose candidates for the advisory vote. The rules for these contests are decided on an annual basis. This description refers to the rules that were effective in 2017 when the party held its previous leader selection.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: 300 delegates have full rights at a party congress. The allocation of delegates between district (=regional) parties is counted by multiplying the amount of district parties' eligible party members (i.e. members who have paid their fees according to the schedule set by the party’s national executive) in the district (=regional) with 300 and dividing the end result with party’s total membership amount. Branch parties, other sub-organizations that function in the district (=regional) party level and groups of 10 individual party members can nominate individuals for delegate position. If there are more nominees than the district/region can send, a vote must be held among eligible members to decide who will be selected.
A91EXCWOMTXT: At least 40% of the members of party's highest executive body must be women.
A92EXCETHTXT: There needs to be at least one Swedish speaking member in the highest executive body but there are No rules about the exact organization from where he/she is to be selected.
A110EXPELTXT: If a member participates in actions that harm or are against the party or its organizations, or acts against the basic principles of the party, or with fraudulent action makes the party activity more difficult,  the member can be expelled from the party.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates for parliamentary elections are selected within electoral districts. District organizations, local organizations (party branches) and groups of 10 individual party members from the electoral district party (and its lower levels) or who live in the electoral district can propose candidates. The district (=regional) congress nominates the final list of candidates, but if there are more proposed candidates than the party can nominate in a district (the amount of parliamentary seats that are being filled), candidates are selected in a vote among party members that are eligbile to vote in parliamentary elections. The district (=regional) congress has the right to change 1/4 of the electoral district candidates with a permission from the national executive.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: Presidential candidate can be proposed by the party council, the national party executive, two or more district (=regional) parties, or 25 local party branches. If more than one candidate is proposed, an advisory primary must be held among members and registered party supporters. The party council makes the final nomination if it does not move the decision to the party congress.
C46PLSELTXT: The party has decided, in terms of principle, that party members select the party chair in a vote. However, the vote can be only advisory because the Finnish law prohibits a binding membership vote in such matters. The possibility for membership vote is not mentioned in the statutes, the party devised special rules for the competition. Candidates to the vote could be proposed by a district (=regional) organization or by 15 local branch organizations. The final official decision was made in the party congress, which according to the statutes could also propose candidates, but the congress was expected to respect the decision of the membership vote.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: There is no fixed total amount for the number of congress delegates. The overall amount of congress delegates is dependent on the amount of sub-organizations and, more importantly, the amount of members within them. For the first 150 members, each local organization (a branch party or special organization's local unit) gets to send one delegate, and then one extra delegate per every 75 additional members. Every local organization is allowed to send at least one delegate. District (=regional) organizations and nation-wide special organizations can each send three delegates.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: The district (=regional) congress, or executive if the congress delegates its powers to it, is responsible for officially nominating party's candidates for parliamentary elections in the electoral district level. However, the district congress/executive may also decide to initiate a membership vote whose results should be, according to the statutes, be taken seriously. Local branches, as organizations, may propose candidates for the membership vote, as well as groups of 15 members (from the same branch) and 30 members from several branches (that operate in the same district's area). With the permission from the national executive, the district congress/executive can change 1/4 of the candidates that were selected in the vote.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The party congress nominates the party's candidate for the presidential election. The party council can decide to hold an advisory primary before the party congress convenes, or otherwise hear the members before the congress. Party congress delegates have the right to propose candidates in the congress and they make the final decision of the candidate.
C46PLSELTXT: The party chair is elected in the party congress. Every eligible congress delegate has the right to propose a candidate for the party chair's position. The final decision is made in a vote among congress delegates. If no one gets a majority of the votes, a runoff is organized between the two candidates who got the most votes in the first round of voting.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: An association may, after providing a written application, be entered to the Party Register as a political party if (1) its main object is to influence state matters, (2) it has signed support cards of at least 5000 citizens entitled to vote in parliamentary elections, (3) the rules and regulations of the association guarantee that democratic principles are abided by in decision-making and in the activities of the association and (4) the association has drafted a party programme, which takes up the goals and principles followed in the national activities, whose final objective is mentioned in the rules and regulations.
A5RECPPGTXT: Members of the parliament that a) have been elected from the same party’s or b) selection committee’s list or c) who the group decides to include upon receiving a request, will form a parliamentary group, when the group is officially registered at the parliament’s central office. A successful registration demand for 1) a name for the group, 2) official statutes and 3) the names of group members, leaders and treasurers. After the group has been entered to the official register, it becomes entitled to certain benefits (allowance for parliamentary group office, etc.).
A81CONDELTXT: There is no fixed total amount for the number of congress delegates. The overall amount of congress delegates is dependent on the amount of sub-organizations and, more importantly, the amount of members within them. Each branch party that has at least three members who have paid their membership fees can send at least one delegate. If the branch has more than ten paid members, it may send another delegate, and after that one extra delegate per every 20 members. One branch cannot send more than 20 delegates. One district (=regional) organization gets to send three delegates and a nation-wide special organization can send 25 delegates.
A110EXPELTXT: According to the local branches' model statutes, the board of the branch can expel a member if he/she 1) acts against the goals of the branch or 2) harms it.
B2BALLOTTXT: Registered parties and independent constituency associations are allowed to nominate candidates for the election of the lower legislative house (the only legislative house at national level). The country is divided to 13 electoral districts and the total amount of MPs (200) is divided between the districts according to their population. Parties can nominate only as many candidates per electoral district as there are seats at the district.
B3CANLAW1TXT: A branch party, a group of 15 members from the same branch party or 30 members from different branch parties (all located in the same electoral district) can nominate candidates for parliamentary elections. However, the district parties, which are the main operative units in the candidate nomination process, may nominate only as many candidates for the final ballot as there are seats to be filled in a electoral district. If party branches and member groups nominate more candidates, a vote must be held among district party's individual members who are legally eligible to vote in the parliamentary election (i.e. have reached 18 years of age) for selecting the candidates who are being put on the final ballot. With a permission from the national party executive, the district party's congress, which sets the final list, can change 1/4 of the nominees, but not from the half that did best in the membership vote.
B28CANSELTXT: The candidates for the parliamentary election are set within districts parties. If more candidates are proposed than what the party can nominate in the district (note: rules for proposing candidates in the first round are not explicitly stated in the statutes), the district congress can decide to hold a membership vote or set the candidate list. If a vote is held, every local branch party that is located within the electoral district can propose candidates for the vote. After the vote, the district (=regional) congress or executive sets the candidate list according to the vote's result, but it can change 1/4 of the candidates with the permission from the national party executive.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The party is allowed to nominate a candidate for the presidential election if it got at least one seat in the previous parliamentary election. In the absence of a party, a candidate needs to form a constituency association with 20000 Finnish citizens that are entitled to vote in general elections. There can be only one candidate per party or constituency association.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: The party must nominate the presidential candidate in a democratic process that is further specified in the party statutes.
BPRESSELTXT: The party congress decides whether the party participates in the presidential election. It also nominates the party's candidate. The congress may also delegate these tasks to the national party council.
C46PLSELTXT: The party chair is elected in the party congress by the officially nominated congress delegates. Every eligible congress delegate has the right to propose a candidate and vote. If no candidate gets a majority of the votes in the first round, a runoff is organized between the two candidates who got most votes in the first round.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: A political party is any group (non-profit organisation) that receives public funding ot has appointed a financial agent or financing association. It must be registered as an voluntary association and provide its statutes, name(s) of its administrators, and the minutes of its constituting general assembly or meeting.
A5RECPPGTXT: At least 15 MPs are necessary to form a parliamentary group in the National Assembly
A79CONWOMTXT: candidates' lists must respect the principle of gender parity
A81CONDELTXT: Delegates are elected by federations in federation congresses. Different lists represent different motions (programmatic texts), and delegates are elected via list-PR, with lists respecting the principle of gender parity (50/50). The number of delegates by federation depends on their number of members: 1 when numbers between 50 and 100, 2 100-205, 1 delegate for every 250 extra members, and 1 delegate when the remainder is superior or equal to 125.
A91EXCWOMTXT: The national executive must strictly respect the principle of parity in its membership. 54 members are elected by the National Council, using PR with lists that must respect the principle of parity (50/50).
A110EXPELTXT: Pretending to resign from the party without leaving elected position; standing as candidate against a candidate invested by the party;
B2BALLOTTXT: No rules for parties
B4CANLAW2TXT: Parties must select an equal number of male and female candidates
B18CANWOMTXT: National decisions ensure the gender balance of candidates
B28CANSELTXT: Members in the constituency select the candidate. However, they must respect the decisions taken by the national party regarding gender parity and agreements with other parties (which might involve not running a candidate in the constituency). The list of candidates seleted throughout the country is then ratified a national convention (delegates elected in federations; the number of deelgates of each federation is a function of the number of members).
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: A candidate needs to be sponsored by at least 500 elected officials from at least 30 departements (there are 101 départements; MEPs, representatives from New Caledonia, and representatives of French citizens living abroad represent a further 3 departements in this context). There cannot be more than 10% of sponsors from the same département. At the end of the designated period, the Constitutional Court verifies the validity of the sponsorships. Candidates must also sign a declaration of interests and activities, a list of assets, and a letter committing to declare their assets at the end of their presidency if they are elected.
BPRESSELTXT: The PS candidate is selected via a 'Citizens' primary' open to all citizens (see note B45PRESSELC for details on who can vote) and co-organised with other left-wing parties that wish to participate. In 2017, the Union des démocrates et des écologistes (UDE), the Front démocrate and the Parti écologiste (all small parties) participated in the primary. The electoral system is the same as for presidential elections: two-round majority system, in which only the 2 candidates with the largest share pof the vote in the 1st round can access the second round
C46PLSELTXT: 3 weeks before the congress, members vote on motions (lists with distinct programmatic orientations for representaton on the National Council). Two weeks before the congress, the heads of lists of the two motions with the largest number of vote compete for the position of First Secretary. Other candidates are possible, possibly with the other motions. All party members can vote.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: A political party is any group (non-profit organisation) that receives public funding ot has appointed a financial agent or financing association. It must be registered as an voluntary association and provide its statutes, name(s) of its administrators, and the minutes of its constituting general assembly or meeting.
A5RECPPGTXT: At least 15 MPs are necessary to form a parliamentary group in the National Assembly
A55OTHERTXT: Federation of EU citizens; federation of French citizens living abroad (territorial)
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: No rules for parties
B4CANLAW2TXT: Parties must select an equal number of male and female candidates
B28CANSELTXT: The statutes are deliberately vague: there is provision for the National Investiture Commission may delegate the selection to the local level (but it may also not delegate); the local level may consult party members (but it can also choose not to do so). Overall, the process is very centarlised (see Squacioni 2017)
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: A candidate needs to be sponsored by at least 500 elected officials from at least 30 departements (there are 101 départements; MEPs, representatives from New Caledonia, and representatives of French citizens living abroad represent a further 3 departements in this context). There cannot be more than 10% of sponsors from the same département. At the end of the designated period, the Constitutional Court verifies the validity of the sponsorships. Candidates must also sign a declaration of interests and activities, a list of assets, and a letter committing to declare their assets at the end of their presidency if they are elected.
BPRESSELTXT: The UMP takes part in an open primary with other parties of the right and centre. Candidates from the UMP need the support of at least 2,500 members  and the support of at least 250 elected officials form at least 30 deoartment and including at least 25 MPs (see B45PRESSELA). The High Authority of the Primary (4 independent members) establishes the list of candidates by ensuring that all candidates meet their party's eligibility criteria. The High Authority also establishes the criteria for inclusion in the electoral list (all citizens on electoral lists who support the primaries objectives and contribute to 2 EUR/ election round (it's a 2-round election)

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: No rules
A5RECPPGTXT: 5% of the members of the Bundestag are minimum requirement to form a parliamentary group.

TITLE: •        Christian Democratic Union for Employees in Germany (Christlich-Demokratische Arbeitnehmerschaft Deutschlands (CDA))
•        Local Political Association between CDU and CSU in Germany (Kommunalpolitische Vereinigung der CDU und CSU Deutschlands (KPV))
•        SME and Economic Association of the CDU / CSU (Mittelstands- und Wirtschaftsvereinigung der CDU/CSU (MIT))
•        East and Central German Association in the CDU / CSU (Ost- und Mitteldeutsche Vereinigung in der CDU/CSU (OMV))
•        Union of displaced persons and refugees (Union der Vertriebenen und Flüchtlinge)
CR4SEATS1: Composed of 1000 delegates of Land party organizations. They may be elected by local, regional (Bezirk) or Land party conferences; plus delegates from foreign groups and honorary party chairs. 200 of the 1000 delegates of Land associations are allocated proportional to the second votes cast for the respective Land lists in the previous federal election - 800 are allocated proportional to the number of members of the Land associations.
CR24_2INCOMNAT: 1 /3rd of seats should be occupied by women (note: this is a recommendation).
A3RGSTR3:
Ein Mitglied kann nur dann aus der Partei ausgeschlossen werden, wenn es vorsätzlich gegen die Satzung der Partei oder erheblich gegen deren Grundsätze oder Ordnung verstößt und ihr damit schweren Schaden zufügt.

A member can only be expelled from the party if it intentionally violates the statute of the party or substantially violates its principles or regulations and thereby seriously damages the party.
A7SUBVOTE: Most of the legal requirements are stated in the Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act- Candidates have to hold the German citizenship and be of full age (18 yrs) on the election day §15- Only parties with 5 representatives in the Bundestag or a Landtag since the last election are entitled to propose their own candidates. Otherwise they need to announce their candidature to the Federal Returning Officer in time. They must have been approved as a party by the Federal Electoral Committee §18 Abs. 2- A party is only allowed to nominate one candidate per constituency and hand in one Land list §18 Abs. 5- No member of a different party may be nominated §21 Abs. 2- Constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic, secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board §21 Abs. 3- The Land list has to have a ranking and candidates need to give their written acceptance to their nomination §27
A8SUBSEAT: Yes, there are several legal rules: Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act (BWG/FEA) cf. answer to the question B6BALLOT.
A23SPENDPTY: One out of three candidates on a list should be female. There are easy ways to make exceptions. There is No rules for direct candidates.
A55RELIGORG:
Individual members:
Constituency candidates: if constituency has a constituency assembly, individual members can participate in the election of constituency candidate. 
List candidates: No role.
Local level organization: 
Constituency candidates: According to the electoral law (Bundeswahlgesetz), constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic and secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board defined by the party (§21 (3)). 
List candidates: No role.

Regional organization:
Constituency candidates: According to electoral law, the Land executive can veto the selection of a constituency candidate. In this case, the procedure has to be repeated and will be binding thereafter. 
List candidates: According to electoral law, a general assembly of a Land organization has to have a secret vote on the Land list.
B30CANETHLIST: The Party congress elects as members of the federal executive committee in separate ballots: 1. the chairperson, [...].The members of national executive body are elected in every second calendar year.
C14LDRCON: In particular, the national executive body is entitled, in addition to the responsible state executive body, to object to the decision of an assembly of members or representatives on the list of candidates in accordance with § 21 (4) of the Federal Electoral Act and § 10 (41) of the European Election Act.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: No rules
A5RECPPGTXT: 5% of the members of the Bundestag are minimum requirement to form a parliamentary group.
A79CONWOMTXT: At least 40% of the delegates have to be women/men.
A81CONDELTXT: Composed of the party executive board and 600 delegates elected by party conferences on regional level (Bezirke).  Every regional unit receives 2 basic seats.  All further delegates are allocated proportional to the number of regional members.  Regions can defer delegate selection wholly or partially to sub-regional party conference (Unterbezirksparteitag) - 40% of the delegates must be women.
A91EXCWOMTXT: At least 40% of the delegates have to be men/women.
A110EXPELTXT:
(1)	Incompatible with the membership in the SPD is 
(a)	the simultaneous membership in another competing political party or voters' association,
(b)	activity, candidacy or providing a signature for another competing political party or voter association,
(c)	Candidacy against the already decided on nomination for a public office or mandate by the party division in charge.
(2)	The same shall apply to associations, which oppose the SPD work. The determination of the incompatibility is made by the Party executive body. He may revoke the determination. This determination shall also bind the arbitration commissions.
B2BALLOTTXT: Most of the legal requirements are stated in the Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act- Candidates have to hold the German citizenship and be of full age (18 yrs) on the election day §15- Only parties with 5 representatives in the Bundestag or a Landtag since the last election are entitled to propose their own candidates. Otherwise they need to announce their candidature to the Federal Returning Officer in time. They must have been approved as a party by the Federal Electoral Committee §18 Abs. 2- A party is only allowed to nominate one candidate per constituency and hand in one Land list §18 Abs. 5- No member of a different party may be nominated §21 Abs. 2- Constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic, secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board §21 Abs. 3- The Land list has to have a ranking and candidates need to give their written acceptance to their nomination §27
B3CANLAW1TXT: Yes, there are several legal rules: Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act (BWG/FEA) cf. answer to the question B6BALLOT.
B18CANWOMTXT: A minimum of 40% of the list candidates have to be women, with list candidates alternating by gender depending on the gender of the leading candidate
B28CANSELTXT:
In the case of nominations for state elections is each participant of the meeting that is entitled to vote also entitled to propose personnel. Furthermore, the personnel proposal right follows the right of petition. From the ranks of the assembly additional proposals may be made. Wahlordnung §3 (6)
State election nominations for the Bundestag elections will be submitted by the districts of the country or the regional association in the in accordance with the party executive. (Party Statutes §12 (3)).
If constituency has a constituency assembly, individual members can participate in the election of constituency candidate (Party Statutes §12 (3)).
According to the electoral law, constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic and secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board defined by the party (Bundeswahlgesetz §21 (3)). 
The executive committee of the regional association or, if regional associations do not exist, the executive committees of the next lower regional associations in whose area the constituency is located, or another entity provided for this purpose in the party statutes, may object to the resolution of a general or representative assembly. The vote must be repeated on such an objection. Their result is final. Bundeswahlgesetz § 21 (4)
C46PLSELTXT:
The election of the party executive committee shall take place at the party conference. Two weeks before the party congress, the acting executive committee shall submit a proposal for the election of the executive committee to the delegates. From the ranks of the party congress additional
proposals will be made. Party Statutes § 23
Proposals by local organizations for the office of the party chairperson and candidate chancellor shall only be valid if they are supported by at least three local organizations. Wahlordnung § 3 (6)
C87ELSELTXT: The candidate for the chancellorship of the SPD may be determined by an intraparty ballot.

TITLE: Proposals by local branches for the office of party chairperson and electoral leader shall only be valid if they are supported by at least three local branches.

A4RECPARTYTXT: No rules
A5RECPPGTXT: 5% of the members of the Bundestag are minimum requirement to form a parliamentary group.

TITLE: Liberalen Schwulen und Lesben
CR4SEATS1: 662 delegates.  660 delegates are elected at Land party conferences.  2 are elected by the membership assembly of the European foreign group (Auslandsgruppe Europa). Other foreign groups send one delegate each without voting rights.
A3RGSTR3:
2) Only a member who intentionally violates the party statues or the basic consensus, and therefore causes substantial damage towards the party, can be expelled.  A violation in the meaning of clause 1 is given if a member, during or previous to the membership, denounced fellow citizens as opponents of a totalitarian regime or abused its social status to persecute others. 
A further violation in the meaning of clause 1 is given through the breach of judicial secrecy, the refusal to join or withdraw from the parliamentarian party, as well as through omission of the due rates.
Also a member who does not meet their accountancy duty properly, doesn’t settle donations according to the law nor the financial regulations of the party statues, or does not use the funds according to the regulations or resolutions and therefor damages the party financially significantly, violates the meaning of clause 1.

B30CANETHLIST:
The members of the highest national executive body (Präsidium des Bundesvorstands) are elected by the party congress (Bundesparteitag) individually, if they are not already a part of it ex officio. 
Requests to be processed and suggestions for elections at the party congress can be turned in by the highest national executive body (Präsidium), every regional/ state organization, local level organizations, 25 delegates of the party congress and 250 individual members.

TITLE: Bernd Riexinger
CR9DUESSTATE: 5% of the members of the Bundestag are minimum requirement to form a parliamentary group.
A37MBRWAIT: Minimum of 50% women. If requirement of 50% women is not reached, then fewer delegates will be send to party  congress.
A39GROUPMB: The party conference is composed of: 500 delegates elected by member or delegate conferences in delegate constituencies. (A delegate constituency comprises one or more territorially connected district (Kreis) party branches. Its boundaries are decided by the Land executives every two years.) Delegates of the youth association (2 delegates per 250 active members; maximum of 50 delegates). Delegates of further national associations within the party (2 delegates per 250 party members that belong to the association; maximum of 50 delegates). Further delegates without full voting rights (i.e. without an active voting right) can also be part of the party conference .
A57BCONGRESS: Minimum of 50% women. If 50% women not reached, the respective seats will remain vacant.
A84EXCNUM: The exclusion is only possible if the member offends against the statues intentionally or infringes the principles and regulations of the party substantially and therefore causes great harm to the party.

TITLE: Dietmar Bartsch
WAVE: Most of the legal requirements are stated in the Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act- Candidates have to hold the German citizenship and be of full age (18 yrs) on the election day §15- Only parties with 5 representatives in the Bundestag or a Landtag since the last election are entitled to propose their own candidates. Otherwise they need to announce their candidature to the Federal Returning Officer in time. They must have been approved as a party by the Federal Electoral Committee §18 Abs. 2- A party is only allowed to nominate one candidate per constituency and hand in one Land list §18 Abs. 5- No member of a different party may be nominated §21 Abs. 2- Constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic, secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board §21 Abs. 3- The Land list has to have a ranking and candidates need to give their written acceptance to their nomination §27
VERSION: Yes, there are several legal rules: Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act (BWG/FEA) cf. answer to the question B6BALLOT.
CR3GOVTPRES: At least 50% of the list have to be female candidates (Bundessatzung §10). One of the first two list candidates needs to be female; alternating rule for the rest of the list: every uneven place on the list is for a female; exceptions are possible.
CR31SPENDYR:
Individual members:
Constituency candidates: if constituency has a constituency assembly, individual members can participate in the election of constituency candidate (Statute § 36 (1)). List candidates: if there is an open general assembly, every individual member can participate in the election (Statute §36 (3)).

Local level organization: 
Constituency candidates: According to the electoral law (Bundeswahlgesetz), constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic and secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board defined by the party (BWG §21 (3)). List candidates: No role.

Regional organization:
Constituency candidates: According to electoral law, the Land executive can veto the selection of a constituency candidate. In this case, the procedure has to be repeated and will be binding thereafter. List candidates: A general assembly of individual members or delegates of a Land organization has to have a secret vote on the Land list (Statute § 36 (3)).

National organization and/or affiliated or other organizations: 
Constituency candidates: No role. List candidates: No role.

A81CONDELTXT: Delegates are elected by the member conferences of local units.  Protection of parity (minimum of 50% women) is obligatory. Determining of the number of delegates sent per local unit: Number of members per local unit multiplied by 750; Result divided by number of members on national level. This number (in round figures) represents the respective number for conference delegates per local unit, whereas the minimum always has to be 1.
A91EXCWOMTXT: The Bundesvorstand consists of six members. There are two chairwomen/men with equal rights, of which a minimum of one must be a woman. The Bundesvorstand consists to a minimum of a half of women.

(2) A member who violates the constitution or basic consensus or otherwise adversely affects the reputation of Alliance 90 / The Greens to an extent that does not justify an exclusion, may be ordered to: 1. Warning, 2. Removal from a party office or the revocation of office status up to a maximum of 2 years, 3. the temporary suspension of membership rights for up to 2 years.
(3) A member who intentionally violates the statute or substantially violates the principles of Alliance 90 / The Greens and thereby seriously damages the party can be excluded.

TITLE: Simone Peter
YEARA: The Bundesversammlung (party congress) elects the members of the Bundesvorstand (including the party political leaders) for a period of two years via a secret ballot. Re-election is possible. All members of the Bundesvorstand are elected at the same Bundesversammlung. If a byelection is required, it only takes place to fill the vacant office for the rest of the term of office. The members of the Bundesvorstand continue proceedings provisionally until a new election takes place.

TITLE: Simone Peter
CR28_2REVPRVNAT: An intra-party ballot of members about the choice of electoral party leaders upon general elections is possible. The quota of women applies to the election. The Bundesversammlung (party congress) decides on exceptions with a simple majority. If a membership ballot for a leadership selection is initiated, rules apply as in section §25 (2) & §25 (5) of the statute.

CR4SEATS1: The district (Kreis) party conference or district assembly of delegates elects 1 party congress delegate per 200 members. The regional (Bezirk) party congress elects 1 party congress delegate per 2000 members of the regional party.
A3RGSTR3: A member can be expelled from the party if it intentional violates the statute of the party or substantially violates its principles or regulations and thereby seriously damages the party. A member, who offers, promises or grants gifts or other benefits in monetary terms to another member for making him not vote or vote in a certain way in elections under these statutes should be excluded from the party. Accordingly, a member who threatens others to put them at a disadvantage should also be excluded. Likewise, a member who demands or accepts gifts or other monetary benefits for not voting or voting in a certain way should be excluded from the party. The same applies in the case of forgery or falsification of admission requests or other party related documents and the use of such falsified documents. From the party should also be excluded who incites or aids to an act according to the named  above.

Otherwise, they need to announce their candidature to the Federal Returning Officer in time. They must have been approved as a party by the Federal Electoral Committee §18 Abs. 2- A party is only allowed to nominate one candidate per constituency and hand in one Land list §18 Abs. 5- No member of a different party may be nominated §21 Abs. 2- Constituency candidates must be elected in a democratic, secret election by an assembly of the party members in a constituency or by a similar board §21 Abs. 3- The Land list has to have a ranking and candidates need to give their written acceptance to their nomination §27
A8SUBSEAT: Yes, there are several legal rules: Bundeswahlgesetz/Federal Electoral Act (BWG/FEA) cf. answer to the question B6BALLOT.
A55RELIGORG:
Individual members:
Constituency candidates: if constituency has a constituency assembly, individual members can participate in the election of constituency candidate. List candidates: No role.

Local level organization:
Constituency candidates: The Local Leadership has the right to propose candidates. Holds a constituency assembly. List candidates: The Local Leadership has the right to propose candidates (Statute §41 (1)).

Regional organization:
Constituency candidates: The Land Leadership has the right to propose candidates and can veto the selection of a constituency candidate. In this case, the procedure has to be repeated and will be binding thereafter (Statute §41). List candidates: A general assembly of delegates of every constituency plus a few further delegates has to have a secret vote on the Land list (Statute §34). The executive boards of all local levels have the right to propose candidates. The Land Leadership has the right to veto. In this case, the procedure has to be repeated and will be binding thereafter (Statute §41).        

National organization:
Not applicable since the CSU is a regional party (Bavaria).

Affiliated or other organizations:
Constituency candidates: No role. List candidates: No role.
B30CANETHLIST: The party congress elects the political leader every two years.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: A party will not be registered if its goals or actions, expressly or implicitly, include any of the following: a. Deny the existence of Israel as a Jewish and democratic state; b. Aggregate racism. c. Support the armed struggle of an enemy state or organization against Israel; d. A reasonable conclusion that the party will be a cover for illegal actions. A party must have administrative regulations concerning: a. Conditions for admission of party members, suspension and exclusion, disciplinary proceedings, their right and obligations; b. The authority of party branches; c. Determining party institutions, functions, composition, powers and ways of operation, and the selection of candidates for elections to the Knesset; d. Dates of meetings of party institutions and deliberation procedures; e. Provisions regarding the administration of the party according to the party law.The party must have a central institution, management and an auditor.

A91EXCWOMTXT: 20% elected by women members of the conference/central committee (same body). Head of N'aamat (Working Women Organization) Likud Faction
A92EXCETHTXT: the non-Jewish sector congress members will elect 10% of the executive as representatives of that sector
A110EXPELTXT: if a member acted against the decision of any party institution or authority, or if the party's court was convinced that the member have stopped acting as such
B2BALLOTTXT: Every Israeli citizen, who on the day of the submission of a list of candidates that includes his name, is twenty one years old or over, is entitled to be elected to the Knesset, unless a court of law has deprived him of this right by virtue of any law, or that he has been sentenced, in a final verdict, to actual imprisonment for a period of over three months, and on the day of the submission of the list of candidates seven years have not yet gone by since he finished serving his term of imprisonment, or if he has been convicted of a serious terror offence, or a serious security offence, as laid down by law, has been sentenced, in a final verdict, to actual imprisonment for a period of over seven years of imprisonment, and on the day of the submission of the list of candidates 14 years have not yet gone by since he finished serving his term of imprisonment - unless the Chairman of the Central Elections Committee has determined that the crime for which he was convicted, under the circumstances of the case, does not carry moral turpitude. A candidates list shall not participate in elections to the Knesset, and a person shall not be a candidate for election to the Knesset, if the goals or actions of the list or the actions of the person, expressly or by implication, include one of the following: (1) negation of the existence of the State of Israel as a Jewish and democratic state; (2) incitement to racism; (3) support for armed struggle by a hostile state or a terrorist organization against the State of Israel
B18CANWOMTXT: the party's election procedure gurentees at least one representation of a woman to the 2-15 positions, 2 for the 2-25 positions, 3 for the 2-31 positions and 4 for the 2-34 positions. if that female candidates were not elected to positions that coincide with this, they will get promoted to a higher position on the list (15th, 25th, 31st and 34th accordingly)
B20CANETHTX: the party's election procedure gurentees at least on representation of a a non-Jew to the 2-24 positions. a non-Jew candidate was not elected to positions that coinside with this, they will get promote to the 24th position
B28CANSELTXT: the party list is selected through a primary, with the exception of 2 seats that are reserved for the party leader's decision and 9 seats reserved for the regional representatives
C46PLSELTXT: the candidates have to be party members and pay a party tax to run for the position. all party members registered at least 16 months before the elections are eligable to vote. if no candidate wins the first round with over 40% of the votes, there will be a secound round in which the 2 leading candidates from the first round will compete within 14 days.
