B2BALLOTTXT: Every Israeli citizen, who on the day of the submission of a list of candidates that includes his name, is twenty one years old or over, is entitled to be elected to the Knesset, unless a court of law has deprived him of this right by virtue of any law, or that he has been sentenced, in a final verdict, to actual imprisonment for a period of over three months, and on the day of the submission of the list of candidates seven years have not yet gone by since he finished serving his term of imprisonment, or if he has been convicted of a serious terror offence, or a serious security offence, as laid down by law, has been sentenced, in a final verdict, to actual imprisonment for a period of over seven years of imprisonment, and on the day of the submission of the list of candidates 14 years have not yet gone by since he finished serving his term of imprisonment - unless the Chairman of the Central Elections Committee has determined that the crime for which he was convicted, under the circumstances of the case, does not carry moral turpitude. A candidates list shall not participate in elections to the Knesset, and a person shall not be a candidate for election to the Knesset, if the goals or actions of the list or the actions of the person, expressly or by implication, include one of the following: (1) negation of the existence of the State of Israel as a Jewish and democratic state; (2) incitement to racism; (3) support for armed struggle by a hostile state or a terrorist organization against the State of Israel
B18CANWOMTXT: there is a guaranteed representation of 2 women between the 1-10 positions on the party list, 11-20 positions and so on. if that hadn’t happened organically, the woman with the highest amount of votes will be promoted according to previously chosen seats.
B20CANETHTX: there are two reserved seats for the ethnic minority, the 17th and 26th positions on the party list (one for a Druz representative and the other for an Arab one).
B28CANSELTXT: the party list is selected through a primary, with the exception of seats that are reserved for gauranteeing representation  of women and ethnic minorities
C46PLSELTXT: the candidates have to be party members and pay a deposite as well as a party tax to run for the position. all party members registered at least 6 months before the elections are eligable to vote. if no candidate wins the first round with over 40% of the votes, there will be a secound round in which the 2 leading candidates from the first round will compete.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: A party will not be registered if its goals or actions, expressly or implicitly, include any of the following: a. Deny the existence of Israel as a Jewish and democratic state; b. Aggregate racism. c. Support the armed struggle of an enemy state or organization against Israel; d. A reasonable conclusion that the party will be a cover for illegal actions. A party must have administrative regulations concerning: a. Conditions for admission of party members, suspension and exclusion, disciplinary proceedings, their right and obligations; b. The authority of party branches; c. Determining party institutions, functions, composition, powers and ways of operation, and the selection of candidates for elections to the Knesset; d. Dates of meetings of party institutions and deliberation procedures; e. Provisions regarding the administration of the party according to the party law.The party must have a central institution, management and an auditor.
A5RECPPGTXT: For these Regulations, a faction in the Knesset [party group] is a list of candidates from which members were elected to the Knesset. The number of faction members will be the number of selected

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Political parties are required to adopt a statute which must contain a number of minimum features such as, for example, the symbol; the address of the central office; the number, the attribution and the composition of the central and peripheral decision-making bodies; the rights and duties of the party members; the methods for candidates’ selection; the measures to ensure the respect of minority rights and gender equality; the disciplinary measures that can be adopted; the rules that ensure transparency, with particular regard to economic and financial management. The Guarantee Commission of Statutes for the transparency and control of the political parties' reporting verifies the compliance of the statute with the principles of internal democracy and transparency. Only after this verification it will be possible to proceed to the registration in the national register of political parties, publicly available on the Internet.
A5RECPPGTXT: Be composed of at least 20 deputies or, alternatively, represent a party that has presented, with the same symbol, in at least twenty districts, its own lists of candidates, who have obtained at least one quotient in a district and at least three hundred thousand valid list votes.
A79CONWOMTXT: Neither of two genders can be represented to a greater extent of two third in the collective bodies or lists of candidates.
A81CONDELTXT: Delegates are chosen by the Federal Council among the Nations that have at least 50 Ordinary Militants Members according to the following proportional formula: N ° of delegates: Total Votes = X: Votes of hte Nation, namely the proportion between the number of delegates to the Federal Congress established by the Federal Council, the total number of the votes obtained by the Northern League in the last political or European elections prior to the Congress and the total of the votes achieved by the Northern League in individual nations.
A91EXCWOMTXT: The Lega Nord promotes gender equality in the collegial bodies and in the elected offices established by the Statute, providing that neither gender can be represented to an extent of more than two thirds.
A110EXPELTXT: Unworthiness or repeated behaviors seriously detrimental to the dignity of other associates; serious reasons that hinder or prejudice the activity of the Northern League or compromise its political image.
B2BALLOTTXT: Each party must deposit the symbol of its electoral list and the electoral programme (with the indication of the party leader) at the electoral office of the the Ministry of the Interior. Electoral lists must be supported by at least 1500 signatures (max 2000) by citizens enrolled in the electoral list for the Chamber of deputies. If a party had a parliamentary representation in both the parliamentary Houses during the last Legislature it does not need to collect any signature. Each party must also specify its official denomination and provide its statute at the electoral office of the the Ministry of the Interior: alternatively, a party must provide a disclosure statement signed by its legal representative. The discolosure statement must include: the identities of the legal representative of the party and that of the responsible of party symbol; the address of the legal seat of the party; the internal bodies of the party (composition and functions).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Regarding candidacies by parties or coalition of parties, it is not allowed to present over 60% of candidates for each gender.
B18CANWOMTXT: The Northern League promotes gender equality in collective bodies and elected offices, providing that neither of the two sexes can be represented in measure over two thirds.
C46PLSELTXT: Both in 2013 and in 2017 the party leader was elected via primaries. In 2017, the procedure followed three steps: 1) Pre-selection. Any candidate must collect at least 1000 signatures in support of his/her candidacy. Each candidate must be member of the party for at least 10 years. In 2017 the only candidates for the office of Federal Secretary were those of Matteo Salvini and Giovanni Fava, both of which exceed 1000 signatures; 2) Primaries. The would-be party leader must deposit to the Federal Segretariat a programme and a list of candidates for the Federal Council - from minimum of 13 to a maximum of 15 names. All candidates for the office of Federal Council must have completed 5 years of seniority of militancy on the day of the Congress and will have to be in good standing with the registration of the current year (2017).  All ordinary and militant members with at least 12 months of membership as of 31 December 2016 have the right to vote and they also have the right to sign in support of the secretaries' candidacies, which need at least 1000 signatures to be able to apply.  3) Election. The Federal Congress with an open vote, by an absolute majority of voters, without prejudice to the faculty of the Congress to deliberate the vote in secret form, elect the Federal Secretary (among the candidates selected trough primaries).

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Political parties are required to adopt a statute which must contain a number of minimum features such as, for example, the symbol; the address of the central office; the number, the attribution and the composition of the central and peripheral decision-making bodies; the rights and duties of the party members; the methods for candidates’ selection; the measures to ensure the respect of minority rights and gender equality; the disciplinary measures that can be adopted; the rules that ensure transparency, with particular regard to economic and financial management. The Guarantee Commission of Statutes for the transparency and control of the political parties' reporting verifies the compliance of the statute with the principles of internal democracy and transparency. Only after this verification it will be possible to proceed to the registration in the national register of political parties, publicly available on the Internet.
A5RECPPGTXT: Be composed of at least 20 deputies or, alternatively, represent a party that has presented, with the same symbol, in at least twenty districts, its own lists of candidates, who have obtained at least one quotient in a district and at least three hundred thousand valid list votes.
A79CONWOMTXT: The Democratic Party assures, at all territorial levels, the equal presence of women and men in representative organizations, such as assemblies and directions, with systems of voting on alternate lists by gender similar to that envisaged for the election of the National Assembly by art. 9 of the Party Statute.
A80CONETHTXT: In the name of pluralism, the methods of election of the Secretaries and of the Assemblies [...] ensure at every territorial level, the representation of minorities with the adoption of proportional systems of election similar to the one set for the formation of the National Assembly
A81CONDELTXT: The National Assembly is the highest  representative body of the Democratic Party. it is composed of 1000 persons, plus 300 persons elected together with the candidates for National Secretary (Art. 4(1)), 100 members elected by MPs and MEPs. Regional segretaries are ex-officio members. All in all, the National Assembly is composed of approximately 1500 people and it does not enjoy autonomous legitimation as it is largely composed on the basis of the vote for the candidates of the National Secretary (Floridia 2019, pp. 49-50)
A91EXCWOMTXT: The Democratic Party assures, at all territorial levels, the equal presence of women and men in representative organizations, such as assemblies and directions, with systems of voting on alternate lists by gender similar to that envisaged for the election of the National Assembly by art. 9 of the Party Statute.
A92EXCETHTXT: In the name of pluralism, the methods of election of the Secretaries and of the Assemblies [...] ensure at every territorial level, the representation of minorities with the adoption of proportional systems of election similar to the one set for the formation of the National Assembly
A110EXPELTXT: Violations of the Statute

TITLE: as well as of the Code of Ethics
CODER: Each party must deposit the symbol of its electoral list and the electoral programme (with the indication of the party leader) at the electoral office of the the Ministry of the Interior. Electoral lists must be supported by at least 1500 signatures (max 2000) by citizens enrolled in the electoral list for the Chamber of deputies. If a party had a parliamentary representation in both the parliamentary Houses during the last Legislature it does not need to collect any signature. Each party must also specify its official denomination and provide its statute at the electoral office of the the Ministry of the Interior: alternatively, a party must provide a disclosure statement signed by its legal representative. The discolosure statement must include: the identities of the legal representative of the party and that of the responsible of party symbol; the address of the legal seat of the party; the internal bodies of the party (composition and functions).
YEAR: Regarding candidacies by parties or coalition of parties, it is not allowed to present over 60% of candidates for each gender.
CR6MBRRUL: The Democratic Party assures, at all territorial levels, the equal presence of women and men in representative organizations, such as assemblies and directions, with systems of voting on alternate lists by gender similar to that envisaged for the election of the National Assembly by art. 9 of the Party Statute.
CR8DUESLVL: In the name of pluralism, the methods of election of the Secretaries and of the Assemblies [...] ensure at every territorial level, the representation of minorities with the adoption of proportional systems of election similar to the one set for the formation of the National Assembly
CR34SPENDCAND: The party National Secretary, taking into account the proposals received from the Regional Secretaries, the requests coming from the territories, the internal pluralism, the positions endorsed by the outgoing parliamentarians and the statutory norms, proposes the lists of candidates to the National Executive Body ('Direzione Nazionale'). The lists of candidates (both for the Chamber of Deputees and for the Senate) are then approved in one vote by the absolute majority of the National Executive.
A110EXPELTXT: The elections for the Secretary and for the National Assembly are governed by a Regulation approved by the Party Executive Body ('Direzione Nazionale') with the favorable vote of the absolute majority of its members (Art. 9(1)). The electoral process is divided into two phases. In the first phase, which ends with the National Convention, nominations for National Secretary and the related political-programmatic platforms are submitted to the scrutiny of the party members. The second phase consists in holding open primaries for the selection of the party national secretary. (Art. 9(2)).

TITLE: Political Party Database
PTYNAME: People's Party for Freedom and Democracy
A4RECPARTYTXT: In order to be officialy recognized as an extra-legislative party, a party has to be registered at the 'Kiesraad' (Electoral Council). To do so, the party ha to be an association with complete legal capacity (registered at the 'Kamer van Koophandel' (Chamber of commerce) and possessing official statutes) and has to pay a deposit of €450,-. To be eligible for state subsidies, there are more requirements.
A5RECPPGTXT: According to the Rules of Procedure of the Lower House, elected MP's who were listed on the same candidate list are formally regarded as a party group.
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
A110EXPELTXT: delay of dues; not meeting the requirements of the membership; acting in violation of party rules; harming the party
B2BALLOTTXT: On January 30, 'Nomination day', parties which want to participate in the elections have to hand in a candidate list for each electoral sub-district in which the party wants to participate, plus an informed consent and ID document from each candidate on the list. Furthermore, parties that participate in the elections for the first time or did not win a seat during the prior elections, have to hand in 30 signed declarations of consent per electoral sub-district (in the sub-district of Bonaire only 10) and have to pay a deposit of €11.250,-.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates can be nominated by regional and local organisations and the national executive; National executive makes the candidate list, but is advised by the electerol and parliamantary leaders; a ballot is held to determine the order of candidates on the list
