A81CONDELTXT: No rules
A110EXPELTXT: delay of dues; not meeting the requirements of the membership; harming the party
B2BALLOTTXT: On January 30, 'Nomination day', parties which want to participate in the elections have to hand in a candidate list for each electoral sub-district in which the party wants to participate, plus an informed consent and ID document from each candidate on the list. Furthermore, parties that participate in the elections for the first time or did not win a seat during the prior elections, have to hand in 30 signed declarations of consent per electoral sub-district (in the sub-district of Bonaire only 10) and have to pay a deposit of €11.250,-.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Party statutes (13-10): In all elections, nominations and appointments, both genders will have a representation of 50 %, or when not dividable by two, as close to 50 % as practically possible.
A81CONDELTXT: There are 300 delegates: 299 delegates allocated to the 19 county party branches, distributed based on average number of dues paying members in the counties in the two years preceding the national conference.  1 delegate to the Svalbard branch (archipelago between Norway and the North Pole) providing an active party branch there.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statutes (§9-2): The National Executive Committee consists of 21 members elected by the party conference (in addition to one member appointed by the youth organization), among these the leader of the Women Network. Party statutes (§13-10): In all elections, nominations and appointments, both genders will have a representation of 50%, or when not dividable by two as close to 50% as practically possible.
A110EXPELTXT: The statues (§12.1) refer to breaches of the party's statues, guidelines or party program as reasons for expulsion from party membership.
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B18CANWOMTXT: In all elections, nominations and appointments, both genders must have 50 % representation; when not dividable by two, this should be as close to 50 % as practically possible. In nominations to the Parliament, Sami-Parliament, County Councils and Local Councils both genders must be represented among the top two candidates on the list.
B28CANSELTXT: The Annual Meetings of the regional (i.e. county) party branches or Board of Representatives of the regional party branches, elect the Nomination Committee with 7-9 members. The regional branch of the youth organization is represented with at least one member in the Nomination Committee and seven delegates at the Nomination Meeting. All municipal party branches and the regional branch of the youth party are encouraged to come up with suggestions for candidates. The rules do not specify that the Nomination Committee should ask members for suggestions, but it doesn't say that it can't ask them either. The Nomination Committee distributes a suggested list to the municipal party branches. The municipal party branches can then give feedback on the list to the Nomination Committee. The regional party branch can decide that individual members and municipal branches should be more involved in the nomination process than specified in the statues. The final list is discussed and approved at the county Nomination Meeting. The delegates to the county Nomination Meeting are sent from local party branches; the number of delegates allocated to each branch is decided based on the number of members the previous year, while still guaranteeing all local branches a minimum representation. The regional branch of the youth party gets at least 7 delegates to the Nomination Meeting. The local delegates to the Nomination Meetings are elected by an all member-meeting or board of representative-meeting. The National Executive Committee set the deadlines for the nomination process before national elections.
C46PLSELTXT: The National Committee, consisting of the Nat. Exec. Comm, two representatives from the youth organization and two representatives from each county branch, elects the Electoral Committee. There are no written rules about who the Electoral Committee should consult with, but in practice they will strive to find a candidate the whole party can agree on and include the organization in the process of finding an appropriate candidate. The candidate is elected at the Party Congress and this is often done by acclamation. The answers to C40-C42 are mostly no, but only because there are no written rules saying that the organization should be involved. There aren't any written rules saying they shouldn't be involved either.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include: 1) The National Committee, which includes a) the National Executive Committee with the party leader, 2 party deputy leaders, 6 members, chairman of the youth organization, leader of the parliamentary party group; b) the 19 county leaders and one more representative from each county elected from and by the county Exe.Com.; c) up to 5 representatives from the parliamentary group; d) the first deputy chairman of the youth organization. 2) MPs which do not meet via the Nat.Com. or Nat.Exe.Com. 3) Government ministers which do not meet via the Nat.Com. or Nat.Exe.Com. 4) 5 members from the youth organizations Nat.Exe.Com. 5) From each county party branch as many delegates as MPs (that the law specified) that were to be elected from the county at the last national election.
A110EXPELTXT: The statues (§3) refer to a) breaches of the party's statues, guidelines or party program and b) actions that somehow could hurt the reputation of the party or party members, as reasons for expulsion from party membership. If a member is convicted of sexual assault he/she will be excluded (etichal and organizational guidelines, 13.1.i)
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Committee makes rules for the nomination process beyond what the statutes specify (§ 12-9). Electoral- /list cooperation with other parties must normally not take place, and in case it does, it must be approved by the National Executive Committee. The Annual Meetings of the regional (i.e. county) party branches elect a Nomination Committee with 5-9 members. The County Boards in the counties decide if the Nomination Meeting is held as a separate meeting or as an own-point-item on the agenda of the county Annual Meeting. Local (i.e. municipal) party branches are encouraged to propose candidates. After the county Nomination Committee has delivered its first draft of a list of candidates, the local branches hold all-member-meetings to discuss and suggest potential changes to the list. They also elect the local delegates for the Nomination Meeting. All members that meet the demands of the party statutes (17 years old, paying and member for three months) have voting rights at the local party Annual Meeting which elects delegates to the county Nomination Meeting. The Nomination Committee makes a final proposal after receiving feedback from the local party branches. The proposal is made public. Local chapters can suggest changes to the list up to 14 days before the Nomination Meeting. The list of alternative candidates and suggestions for different rankings are sent to the delegates at least a week before the Nomination Meeting. The delegates for the Nomination Meeting are: 1) The members of the County Board. 2) The party’s elected representatives in the county council/government if they are not members of the county Board. 3) The Party’s members of Parliament, the Sami Parliament and government who come from the county. 4) Two delegates from the county board of the youth organization. 5) The local delegates to the county Nomination Meeting who are elected at Annual Meetings in local party branches: 1 delegate for each, and in addition: 1 delegate for each 650 votes in the municipality (max. 14 delegates). 1 delegate if the election result in the municipality is above the county average. 1 delegate if the number of paying members in the local branch is 1 % or more of the population in the municipality. Sum: 17 delegates max. The number of delegates for local branches must be increased to ensure that local branches constitute at least 2/3 of the delegates. The Nomination Meeting decides the final list. The County Board with the approval of the Nat. Exc. Comm. can summon the party to a new Nomination Meeting if the first meeting was not carried out in accordance with party statues and the rules for the nomination procedure.
C46PLSELTXT: There are no written rules regulating the involvment of party organs in the selection process. But the rules do not say that party branches should be excluded from the process either. Party statues say that an Electoral Committee is elected by the National Meeting (§7-C-10). In practice, this committee will consult party branches in order to find a candidate the organization can gather around at the National Meeting. The political leader is elected at the National Meeting.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A67CONOTHER: Students' League of the Conservative Party (Høyres studenter)
A79CONWOMTXT: The County Women's Forums have the right to send one representative each. The leader of the national Women's Forum is a member of the National Committee who also participate as delegates.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include:  1) The National Committee* (amongst others, including the Nat.Exe.Com with the party leader, 2 deputy leaders, women- and youth leader and two members);   2) Parliamentary Group;  3) Government Group; 4) County Mayors or group leaders in County Councils without a Høyre-mayor (19);  5) One representative from the Women`s Forum in each county (19);  6) As many delegates from each county as MPs the county elects +1 delegate for every 15000 Høyre-votes in the county at the last national election ; 7) 1 delegate elected by Svalbard Høyre, 20 by the youth organization, 6 by the student organization, 7 by the senior organization; 8) the leader of the party group in the Sami Parliament 9) The Secretary General. *Note: Høyre has different names for its party bodies, and calls this the Nat.Exe.Com. We have called it the National Committee here, as this body is what other parties call Nat.Committee. This makes it comparable across parties in terms of organizational functions, status and hierarchy.
A82EXCNAME: The National Executive Committee (Party`s name: the Working Committee(Arbeidsutvalget)).
A91EXCWOMTXT: The leader of the Women`s Forum is a member.
A110EXPELTXT: Membership in a political party other than Høyre, bringing the name of the Party into disrepute, breaches of the party statues and/or ethical guidelines, professing to other political beliefs  than those building on the party’s statuory objective.
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Committee makes guidelines for the nomination process. Deviations from the guidelines must be approved by the National Committee. Electoral- /list cooperation with other parties must be approved by the National Committee, and the committee may also instruct the regional branches to enter such cooperation. The county board appoints a Nomination Committee. All members and others are encouraged to suggest candidates. After the county Nomination Committee has delivered its first draft of a list of candidates, local party branches hold all member-meetings in the municipal branches and sub-organizations or intra-party referendums with "test nomination votings". The municipal branches elect their delegates to the County Nomination Meeting based on this formula: 1 delegate if the party received 20-150 votes in the municipality in the last national election. After that: 1 delegate for each started 250 votes in the municipality up to 1900. After that, 1 delegate for each started 400 votes up to 7900. Thereafter, 1 delegate for each started 700 votes. Sub-organizations do not get any delegates at the Nomination Meeting. The delegates are elected at an all-members meeting or can be appointed by the Board of Representatives if the local branch has such an organ. To be able to vote in the test nomination voting and when electing delegates, one must have been a member for at least four weeks and have paid the membership dues before the meeting starts. New members must have paid their membership dues at least four weeks before the meeting. Only those who have voting rights in national elections are able to vote. The Nomination Committee makes a final prioritized list proposal on the basis of the results of the test nomination votings and their own assessments. The list is made public and distributed to the Nomination Meeting delegates at least 14 days before the Nomination Meeting. The Nomination Meeting decides the final list.
C46PLSELTXT: The mandate of the Electoral Committee said that "The Electoral Committee should find the most suitable candidate".  Thus, there are no written rules regulating the involvment of party organs in the selection process. But there are No rules saying they shouldn't be involved either. Party statues say that an Election Committee consisting of 11 members is elected at the National Meeting. In practice, this committee will consult party branches in order to find a candidate the organization gather around at the National Meeting. The political leader is elected at the National Meeting and this usually happens by acclamantion.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Party statutes (9-1):The woman-political Leader is a member of the National Council, and its members are delegates. Party statutes (3-2): At least 40 % of all the people elected to all representative bodies at county and national level have to be women. Party statutes (7-3): Gender distribution must be considered when the counties Annual Meetings elect their delegates.
A80CONETHTXT: Party statutes (8-2 and 7-3): Among the members of the National Council, which are all delegates, at least two must have ethnic minority background.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include: 1) County delegates: The National Council decides and distributes among the 19 counties a number of up to 300 delegates in total. The distribution is based on the number of paying members at the last turn of the year, with a minimum of 5 and a maximum of 30 delegates from each county. The County Leader represents the County. The local branches suggest delegates, and the county Annual Meeting elects them according to numbers of members, as well as and geographic- and gender distribution. 2) The National Council, which include a) the Central board with the party leader, two party deputy leaders, the party secretary, the women-political leader, the leader of the youth organization, and five members; b) one member from each of the 19 counties, elected at their Annual Meetings; and c) 6 members elected by the national conference.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statutes (3-2): At least 40 % of all the people elected to all representative bodies at county and national level have to be women.
A92EXCETHTXT: Party statutes (3-3): Minority representation should be strived for in all representative bodies. Party statutes (8-2): 2 of the following 11 people will have an ethnic minority background: the 5 ordinary members of the National Executive Committee and the 6 members of the National Council that are elected directly by the party conference.
A110EXPELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B28CANSELTXT: The Annual Meeting of the county branches elects a Nomination Committee a year ahead of a national election. The youth organization should be represented in the committee if they have a branch in the county. The Nomination Committee must arrange for a high degree of influence for members, local branches and the youth organization in the nomination process. In its list proposal, the Nomination Committee must emphasize good gender and geographical balance. The proposal should reflect the diversity of the county population.  Municipal party branches elect delegates to the county nomination meeting where the list is decided. One or more top candidates can be elected through an intra-party referendum at the county level if the County Annual Meeting decides so. A candidate is included in the intra-party referendum if 1) the candidate has the support of more than half of the members of the Nomination Committee OR 2) the candidate is nominated by signature by at least 5 percent of the members in the county. The Nomination Meeting decides on the whole list if none of the candidates are elected by an intra-party referendum.
C46PLSELTXT: The National Council appoints an Electoral Committee before the National Meeting (§7-7). The mandate for the Committee working before the 2017 National Meeting stated that the Committee should ensure a broad process that included the whole party. There is not made any specifications with regards to who they should include and how and we found this description too vague to answer yes to C40-C43. But there are No rules saying that they shouldn't be included in the process either. In practice, the Committee will try to find a candidate the National Meeting can gather around. The leader is elected that the National Meeting and this is often done by acclamation.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Party statutes (4 A): In all elections and nominations both sexes shall  be represented with at least 40 %. Party statutes (10.2.g, 11.2.e and 12.1): 26 delegates from the women organization. Ex officio: The organization's leader and three members through their position in the National Committee. Elected by the organization: The women’s organization's county leaders and three members from its working committee/Board.
A80CONETHTXT: Party statutes (§ 10 - 2): Delegates to the national conference are the party`s MPs in the Sami Parliament, the leaders of the Sami Political Forum in electoral districts, three members of the board of the Sami Political Council.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include:  1) National Committee, which includes a) the Nat.Exe.Com. with the party leader, two deputy leaders, six members elected by the congress, and the leader of the youth- and women organization, and studies association; b) the leaders of the county organizations; c) 2 members of the parliamentary group; d) one member - Sami Parliament group; e) 3 members - women`s organization; f) 3 members - youth organization; g) one member - Sami Political Councils board. 2) MPs and (if any) government members. 3) Four representatives of each electoral district for national elections elected by the County’s annual meetings. 4) 120 representatives of the municipal chapters elected by the county organizations’ annual meeting. The Sainte-Laguë method is used to distribute the delegates according to the number of members in each county at the end of last year. 5) County Mayors, County Deputy Mayors and group leaders in the County Councils.  5) Sami Parliament - MPs.  6) Women's organization: county leaders + 3 Board members. 7) Youth organization: county leaders + 5 Nat.Exc.Com members. 8) The leaders of the Sami Political Forum in electoral districts + 3 members of the board of the Sami Political Council.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statutes (12.1): Of the 9 members elected by the party congress, there will be at least 4 of each gender. Party statutes (12.1): The leader of the women organization is a member.
A110EXPELTXT: Bringing the Party into disrepute.
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B18CANWOMTXT: In all elections and nominations both genders must be represented with at least 40 %. Both genders must be equally represented among the top-four candidates on the list of candidates.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Committee makes the guidelines for the nomination process, where the rules in the statutes are specified and additional rules are set out. This summary is based on the guidelines for 2016-2017. The regional (i.e. county) Annual Meeting or County Board appoints a county Nomination Committee of 7-9 members. Both sexes should have at least 40 percent representation in the Nomination Committee and all parts of the county should be represented. The youth and women’s organization elects one representative each for the Committee if the sub-organizations have a County Board in the area. The Committee asks the local party branches as well as local branches of the youth and women’s organization to suggest no more than five names from the county, at least one from their own municipality. All members should be encouraged to participate by suggesting candidates in this first round of proposals to the Nomination Committee, either directly or at all member-meetings. The county Nomination Committee uses the first round-results to suggest 3-5 names it considers to be the most likely (supported) top candidates. The Committee should give priority to those candidates suggested by most branches, but can also launch other candidates. In the second round, the local branches hold all member-meetings to decide on a proposal of a complete list of candidates. All members may participate when local branches call all member-meetings to decide on their proposal of a complete list of candidates. The second round-meetings also elect the local branches delegates to the county Nomination Meeting: 1 delegate per started 300 votes in the municipality in the last (national or regional) election. 1 delegate per 60 members of the branch in the last election year (60-119 = 1 delegate, etc.). All local party branches get at least two delegates. The boards of the youth- and women organizations elect three delegates each to the Nomination Meeting. The Nomination Committee makes a final proposal of a complete list of candidates that is distributed to the delegates and published. The party organization should be made familiar with any suggestions to add other top candidates or to change the order of the top candidates on the proposed list in ample time before the County Nomination Meeting. The County Nomination Meeting decides on the final list.
C46PLSELTXT: The Party Congress appoints the county branches that will be represented in the Electoral Committee before the next Party Congress. As a rule it should be 50 % of the counties each year. The members of the Electoral Committee are appointed by the National Committee after the county branches have nominated two candidates (a man and a woman) from their branch. The youth organization gets one representative in the Elec. Comm.  There are no written rules about who the Electoral Committee should consult, but they strive to find a candidate the whole party can agree on and include the organization in the process of finding an appropriate candidate. The candidate is elected at the Party Congress and this is often done by acclamation as there very seldom is more than one candidate for the position as party leader by the time of the Party Congress.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Party statutes (11): In all elections/appointments to the party`s political and organizational bodies with more than three members, both genders will as far as practically possible have a representation of 40 %. Party statutes (4): The party`s women's organization can send 13 delegates: its leader as a member of the National Executive Committee, and 12 delegates that the women's organization elects.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include:  1) The National Executive Committee, which include the party leader; two party deputy leaders; 5 members; the leaders of the women- and youth organization; the leader of the parliamentary group; and one representative from the party`s employees. 2) The parliamentary group.  3) Members of the government if the party has any. 4) Delegates from the counties elected by the following rules:  a) the county leader, 2 delegates if the party has up to 500 members, 3 delegates if up to 1000 members, 4 delegates if up to 1500 members, 5 delegates if up to 2000 members,  6 delegates if up to 2500 members, 7 delegates if up to 3000 members, 8 delegates if up to 4000 members and 1 additional delegate for every started 1000 members thereafter. / b) 1 delegate for up to 2000 votes in the county at the last national election, 2 delegates for up to 5000 votes, 3 delegates for up to 9000 votes, 4 delegates for up to 14000 votes, and 1 delegate for every started 5000 votes thereafter. 5) 12 delegates elected by the women organization. 6) 12 delegates elected by the youth organization. 6) The employees have two delegates with full rights in the issues that are not political.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statutes (11): In all elections/appointments to the party`s political and organizational bodies with more than three members, both genders will as far as practically possible have a representation of 40 %. Party statutes (6): The leader of the party`s women organization is a member.
A110EXPELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B18CANWOMTXT: In political and organizational positions, women and men are to be represented as equally as possible. When pre-cumulating lists, and in all elections and appointments to the party`s political and organizational bodies with more than three members, the results as much as practically possible must be at least 40 % of each gender. To secure even representation of the genders, there should be two women and two men among the top four candidates.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Executive Committee makes the guidelines for the nomination process, where the rules in the statutes are specified and additional rules are set out. These are merely guidelines and the county branches can make their own rules if they wish. The answers in this section are based on these guidelines. The county Annual Meeting appoints the regional (i.e. county) Nomination Committee and decides the rules for the nomination process. They decide whether they want one or two rounds and whether the members should be directly involved in the hearings. The guidelines include two hearings and the direct involvement of members. The first round includes 1) a hearing where all members are invited and asked to participate directly by suggesting candidates. 2) The local (i.e. municipal) party branches and the county branches of the Women’s and the Youth organization are asked to suggest candidates for the top four spots in addition to four candidates from their county. It is recommended that the list is processed by an all-members meeting, but it can also be processed at a board meeting in the local chapter. Members may participate in the municipal chapter hearing if they have been members for at least three months, have paid the membership dues and have voting rights in the national election. The Nomination Committee makes a list of all the candidates suggested by members and municipal branches. The number of branches supporting a candidate is put on the list if a candidate has been suggested by one or more municipal branches along with any other information the municipal branches should be made familiar with. Suggestions by formal party organs are given more weight than suggestions from individual members. This list is distributed in the second hearing. In the second round, all-member-meetings in the local branches must propose a list of 10 prioritized candidates and elect delegates to the county Nomination Meeting: 2 delegates for 0-150 votes in the municipality in the last national election, and thereafter: 1 delegate for every started 250 votes up to 1900 votes. 1 delegate for every started 400 votes up to 7900 votes, and thereafter 1 delegate for every started 700 votes. The Nomination Committee makes a final list of candidates after interviewing potential top candidates. The proposed list is distributed to the municipal branches before the Nomination Meeting. The County Board sets the date for the Nomination Meeting where the candidates are presented and the final list is discussed and passed. In addition to the municipal branch delegates, the County Board, the youth organizations and the women’s organization can be represented with no more than three delegates each at the Nomination Meeting.
C46PLSELTXT: An Electoral Committee is appointed by the Party Congress. The Committee consists of 9 members, including one each from the women- and youth organization and one from the legislative party group. The party organization is asked to propose candidates to the Electoral Committee in the first round. The County Branches, the youth organization and the women’s organization receive a list with the suggested candidates and information about whether the current candidate wants reelection or not in the second round. It is up to the regional (i.e. county) branches to decide as to the extent and degree of the involvement of local party branches and individual members. The involved groups and branches deliver their consultation response to the Electoral Committee. The responses make an important foundation for work of the Electoral Committee, but the guidelines also emphasize that the Committee works independently of the responses. The Electoral Committee’s final proposal is distributed about a month before the National Meeting. The party leader, deputy leaders and members of the National Executive Committee are elected at the Party Congress.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A55OTHERTXT: The sub-organization Liberal Students of Norway (Norges Liberale Studentforbund).
A67CONOTHER: The student sub-organization Liberal Students of Norway (Norges Liberale Studentforbund)
A79CONWOMTXT: The party`s women's organization needs to fulfill the following requirements to get representation at the Party Congress according to the national statues: 1) Have at least 100 members; 2) Have local chapters in at least four counties or educational institutions in the country; 3) The sub-organization must have held an annual meeting either the same year as the Party Congress or the year before. If these requirements are met then the women’s organization gets the following delegates: i) one member of the women organization through membership in the National Council; ii) a minimum of 2 to a maximum of 11 members of the women's organization. How many are selected this way depends on the number of members, in competition with the youth organization and the student organization.; iii) If the women’s organization has at least 400 members it will get one more member in the National Council who will also be a delegate. Thus, the number of delegates is a minimum 3 and maximum 13 given that the organization fulfills the requirements. In addition, the template statues for local and country chapters (3) state that both genders as a rule should have a representation of at least 40 % in the Party Congress delegations.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include: 1) The National Committee, which include a) the Nat.Exe.Com. with the party leader, two party deputy leaders, four members, and the leaders of the women-, youth- and student organization if the respective organization has at least 400 members; b) eight members; c) the leaders of the county branches; d) one member elected by the women-, youth- and student organization if the respective organization fulfills the following requirements: i) Have at least 100 members; ii) Have local chapters in at least four countries or educational institutions in the country; iii) The sub-organization must have arranged an annual meeting; e) one additional member elected by the women-, youth- and student organization if the respective organization has at least 400 members; 2) Delegates elected by the counties - rules of allocation:  a) 1 delegate for each started 1200 votes up to 8000 votes at the last regional election, and 1 delegate for each started 2000 votes thereafter.  b) 1 delegate for each started 120 paying members at the last turn of the year. 3) 1 delegate for each started 120 paying members at the last turn of the year to the Svalbard branch (archipelago between Norway and the North Pole) and the party chapter for those living abroad. 4) The youth, women and student organization: 15 additional delegates in total, the number for each decided by the number of members, though with at least 2 delegates each. (To qualify they must: hold annual meetings, be organized in 4 counties or educational institutions, have 100 members).
A77EXCOTHER: The student sub-organization Liberal Students of Norway (Norges Liberale Studentforbund)
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statues (3): As a rule, both genders should have a representation of at least 40 % in the party boards and committees. Party statues (7): The leader of the women's organization gets a seat in the Nat. Ex. Com. if the organization has at least 400 members.
A110EXPELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Committee makes the guidelines the counties use in the nomination process. The regional (i.e. county) Annual Meeting or a meeting in the County Board elects a Nomination Committee with a leader, deputy leader and 1-3 other members. The youth organization or other sub-organizations may participate as members in the Nomination Committee. The Nomination Committee invites all members and local (i.e. municipal) chapters in the county to propose candidates. After this, a list of all proposed candidates is sent to the members and local chapters (in alphabetical order). Members and local chapters are asked to return the list with their ranking of the candidates. Paying members in the branches may participate in the all member-meetings at the local level where this is done.  At some point, the Nomination Committee invites all members to a meeting, where proposed top-candidates may present themselves and answer questions. The composition of the Nomination Meeting is the same as to the regional (i.e. county) Annual Meeting. Local branches elect delegates to the meeting in separate all member-meeting, based on the number of members: Up to 25 members in the local branch = 1 delegate, 26-50 members = 2 delegates, 51-100 members = 3 delegates, and after that 1 delegate per 50 members. In addition, based on number of votes in the municipality in the last election in the county: Up to 150 votes = 1 delegate, 151-1900 votes = 1 delegate per started 250 votes; 1901-7900 = 1 delegate per started 400 votes; and more than 7900 votes = 1 delegate per 700 votes.  The Committee’s proposal is distributed to all members and made public before the  Nomination Meeting. The proposed list is used as a departure point in the Nomination Meeting. Delegates at the Nomination Meeting can only propose changes to specific spots on the list. The candidates who receive more than 50 percent of the votes are elected.
C46PLSELTXT: The Party Congress elects the Electoral Committee the year before the election of party leader. There are no written rules about who the Electoral Committee should consult, but they strive to find a candidate the whole party can agree on and include the organization in the process of finding an appropriate candidate. All members were invited to suggest candidates until a given date. The candidate is elected at the Party Congress and this is often done by acclamation as there very seldom is more than one candidate for the position as party leader by the time of the election.

TITLE: Political Party Database
CR21ORGLDR: Une Aina Bastholm and Rasmus Hansson
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: The leader and one member of the board of the women's group can attend the party congress with the right to speak and make suggestions but they do not have voting rights at the congress.
A81CONDELTXT: The delegates include: 1) 190 county delegates distributed among the county chapters according to the chapter’s share of members, but in such a way that each county gets at least three delegates; 2) 12 delegates elected by the youth organization; 3) 4 delegates elected by the student organization; 4) Chapters that do not belong to a county (“fylkesløse”) elect one delegate in total; 5) The national spoke persons. (Statues, 7)
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statues (14.3): Both genders as should have a representation of at least 40 % in the Nat. Exc. Comm.. Party statues (9.1): The two spokespersons can not be of the same gender. Both gender should be represented.
A110EXPELTXT: The named grounds are: 1) Bringing the name of the Party into disrepute; 2) Agreeing to filling a spot on an electoral list that is in competition with the Environmental Party of the Greens.; 3) Evidently obstruction of the Party principles; 4) Gross violations of the statues or the written guidelines.
B1LEGLDRTXT: Une Aina Bastholm and Rasmus Hansson
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B18CANWOMTXT: Every other candidate on the list should male and female.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Committee makes the guidelines for the Nomination Process. A Nomination Committee is elected at the County Annual Meeting the year before the election. The county youth organization is represented in the Committee. The Committee receives suggestions for candidates from members, local chapters and sub-organizations in the county. The Committee sends a draft list to the local chapters during the process. After receiving feedback from the local chapters and members, a final proposal for the list of candidates is presented at a county Nomination meeting. The final proposal is distributed to the members at least a month before the Nomination Meeting. If there is disagreement among the members of the Committee about the candidates or the ranking of the candidates, both candidates are listed along with the number of Committee members who prefer the one to the other. The delegates at the Nomination meeting are either 1) all members in the county who have paid their membership dues OR 2) delegates elected by the local chapters. It varies from one county to the next, but 1) is the most used option. Those with voting rights at the Nomination meeting can also propose new candidates as replacements for those on the list presented by the Nomination Committee (benkeforslag). A candidate needs more than 50 % of the votes to get a spot on the list.
C10LDRNAME: Une Aina Bastholm and Rasmus Hansson
C46PLSELTXT: The Party Congress elects an Electoral Committee where both genders have a representation of at least 40 % (statues 14.3). The youth organization is represented in the committee. The two spokespersons have to be one of each gender and are elected together for two years at the time at the Party Congress (statues 9.1). According to the mandate of the Elec. Comm., the committee encourages the leaders of the county chapters, the youth organization, the student organization and women’s network to discuss the composition of the Nat. Exc. Com. and other bodies, including the spokespersons, with their boards. The county board proposals should as far as possible reflect the suggestions from the local chapters. Suggestions from the county chapters are given more weight by the Elec. Comm. than those coming directly from the local chapters. Suggestions from individual members are given less weight by the Elec. Comm. than those coming from people currently holding the position in question. The final proposal should reflect 1) the candidates’ personal qualification; 2) Political breadth; 3) Geographical representation; 4) Representation of different age groups. The whole committee is present when they interview candidates for the position as spokesperson. The committee also does a background check of the spokespersons candidates and talks to former employers among others. The candidates for spokespersons must sign a loyalty pledge stating that they will be loyal towards the Party’s politics and values, ethical guidelines and that they’ve been open and honest about matters relevant to the Elec. Comm..
C59PLNAME: Une Aina Bastholm and Arild Hermstad

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Must have signatures from a minimum of 5000 people with voting rights in national elections.Must have a memorandum of association, confirming the establishment of the party. Must inform who is elected as members of the party`s executive body, and have the authority to represent the national party in cases pertaining to the law. Must have a by-law determining which organ of the party chooses the party`s executive body. Must have a name which cannot be confused with other registered parties or sami-political units.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be elected from the same registered political party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Statues (12): At least 50 percent of the delegates shall be women.
A81CONDELTXT: The National Committee decides the distribution of delegates between the municipal chapters. The distribution formula is based on the membership numbers of each chapter. All municipal chapters with a minimum of three members shall have at least one delegate. The delegates are elected at  Municipal chapter meeting. At least 50 percent of the delegates shall be women.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Party statues 12.1: All party organs shall consist of at least 50 percent women.
A110EXPELTXT: Bringing the name of the Party into disrepute, obstructing the work of the Party or breaking the Statues.
B2BALLOTTXT: The party or group must deliver its list (lists) for a county (the counties) by 12:00 AM March 31st in the election year. Each party or group can only have one list in each electoral district (i.e. each county). The list must indicate what election it applies to and include a headline that denotes the party or the group that has presented the list. The headline of the list has to be the same as the registered party name if the proponent is a registered political party. The party- or group-name must not be confusable with another party- or group-name. All lists must declare a spokesperson with a substitute. All lists must have as many candidates on the list as MPs to be elected from the county, and can have up to six more in addition. All lists must include the first name, surname and year of birth for all candidates. Information about the candidate’s work position and residence must be added if the information is necessary to distinguish one candidate from another. The candidates can not have their name on any other lists for the same election in the same electoral district. For registered political parties which received at least 500 votes in one county or 5000 votes nationwide in the last national election, and for parties registered after the last national election, list(s) must be signed by two members of the party`s highest body in the county which the list is from. For other parties or unregistered groups, list(s) must be signed by at least 500 people with voting rights in the county. A list containing the birth date and address of the signatories must be enclosed with the submitted list proposal.
B18CANWOMTXT: Party statues 12.1: All electoral lists shall consist of at least 50 percent women. At least every other candidate on the lists should be a woman to ensure that women also make their way to the top of the list. Exceptions can be made by the National Committee(landsstyret) or other organs that are given the power by the National Council to make such exceptions.
B28CANSELTXT: Candidates are selected at the Annual Meeting of the county branch or at a Nomination Meeting. The local (municipal) branches elect delegates on the basis of the number of members. At least 50 percent of the delegates must be women. At least 50 percent of the candidates on the final list must be women. At least every other candidate on the list should be a woman to make sure that there are women among the top candidates. Exceptions from this rule must be approved by the National Committee or other organs who the National Committee has given such rights. Completion of the list can be delegated from the County Annual/Nomination Meeting to the County Board. The county branches are free to have their own statues. Thus, procedures may vary from one county branch to another. In practice, there will be a Nomination Committee or an Electoral Committee that makes a list proposal for the County Annual/Nomination Meeting even though this is not stated in the rules. In the making of the proposal the Electoral Committee will ask for input from party branches and members. Thus, the involvement of members and local branches will in practice be much better than what is described in the formal rules.
C46PLSELTXT: The National Committee appoints the Electoral Committee. The mandate of the Electoral Committee was approved by the National Committee and said that the Electoral Committee should take into account the signals that appeared in the debate in the party in addition to § 10 and § 12 in the party statues when making a proposal for a new National Committee (incl. party leader). Both § 10 and § 12 are about the composition of the National Committee, and do not specify anything about the party leader. There are no written rules about who the Electoral Committee should consult with, but they strive to find a candidate the whole party can agree on and include the organization in the process of finding an appropriate candidate. The candidate is elected at the Party Congress and this is often done by acclamation. As the mandate does not specify the involvement of the different branches we have chosen to answer no. But there are No rules saying they shouldn't be included, and in practice the selection process is more inclusive.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: The motion for registration should indicate party name, its abbreviation, seat, names and addresses of people entitled to represent party and take financial obligations; party statutes and the list of at least 1000 supportering signatures.
A5RECPPGTXT: The numerical requirement of 15 members is the only condition that is required to register a party group with full privileges (klub parlamentarny).
A81CONDELTXT: delegates from regional councils, members of the national council, party members performing some public functions in the state
A110EXPELTXT: A member of the Platforma may be punished for non-compliance with the provisions of the statute, failure to comply with resolutions of the Platform's authorities, conduct in a manner contrary to the Platform's program, for unethical or dishonest acts and other actions to the detriment of the Platforma.
B2BALLOTTXT: Only electoral committees. Each committee can only have 1 electoral list per district. Each list must have at least as many candidates as there are seats up for election in the district and cannot be longer than twice the number of seats up for election in the district. No list may have fewer than 35% of either females or males. Each list must be supported by at least 5000 signatures of those who have a right to vote and live in the district (some exemptions apply); parties which are registered in at least half the districts do not need to present signatures. Lists have to be filed no later than at midnight 40 day before elections. Candidates may only run in one district, and cannot run simultaneously for the Sejm (lower chamber) and Senate (upper chamber) seat. They must be at least 21 on the election day and must be a Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution).
B3CANLAW1TXT: 1) candidate must be at least 21 on the election day and must be Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution). 2) A list in a district cannot have fewer than 35% of females or males (quota).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Yes. Each list has a gender quota: there must be at least 35% male and 35% female candidates (Electoral Code).
B28CANSELTXT: The region's council presents candidates' proposals. The national council approves the lists of candidates
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Formally speaking, parties are not mentioned, only electoral commitees of a presidential candidate, which have to collected at least 100000 signatures to register a candidate.
BPRESSELTXT: status does not mention the selection of a presidential candidate
C46PLSELTXT: The Chairman of the Platform is elected in the general election by all members of the Platform who have an active electoral right. The national council selects candidates from among those who have received written support from at least 10 members of the National Council. A member of the National Council may support more than one candidate.

B28CANSELTXT: PiS chairman puts candidates for election into acceptance, the Political Committee approves them. Candidates' opinions are submitted to the Committee at regional level by regional councils and at local level by regional boards.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Formally speaking, parties are not mentioned, only electoral commitees of a presidential candidate, which have to collected at least 100000 signatures to register a candidate.

A5RECPPGTXT: The numerical requirement of 15 members is the only condition that is required to register a party group with full privileges (klub parlamentarny).
A81CONDELTXT: 1) 1 delegate is selected by each district  (Powiat) convention.   2) delegates chosen by provincial conventions. The number of delegates set by the Governing Council based on: the number of votes PSL received in a province in elections to the Sejm and regional assemblies as well as the number of PSL members registered in a province and the level of political activity in the province. Beyond elected representatives: the honorary Chairman, the Chairman, members of the National Council, Peer Tribunal and Review Board, Disciplinary Spokesman,  parliamentarians-members of PSL, provincial chairmen.
A110EXPELTXT:
The member bears disciplinary responsibility for misappropriation of ideological and programmatic values, violating party statutes, disobeying
and failing to comply with resolutions of the party authorities or for disreputable behaviour bringing disgrace to the party (...). The member is also expelled if he or she runs for seat in any type of election from other electoral lists; wherease for elected members, if they change group membership in either national parliament or local assembly without authorization from the party.

Each list must have at least as many candidates as there are seats up for election in the district and cannot be longer than twice the number of seats up for election in the district. No list may have fewer than 35% of either females or males. Each list must be supported by at least 5000 signatures of those who have a right to vote and live in the district (some exemptions apply); parties which are registered in at least half the districts do not need to present signatures. Lists have to be filed no later than at midnight 40 day before elections. Candidates may only run in one district, and cannot run simultaneously for the Sejm (lower chamber) and Senate (upper chamber) seat. They must be at least 21 on the election day and must be a Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution).

B4CANLAW2TXT: Yes. Each list has a gender quota: there must be at least 35% male and 35% female candidates (Electoral Code).
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Formally speaking, parties are not mentioned, only electoral commitees of a presidential candidate, which have to collected at least 100000 signatures to register a candidate.
BPRESSELTXT: There are no written rules on this issue other than in the statutes. It is the National Electoral Convention, called by the National Council, that, upon the motion of party executive, chose a presidential candidate (art. 61 of the statutes).
C46PLSELTXT: Party chairman is elected by the congress, in a secret ballot, by an absolute majority of votes, from among at least two candidates. Candidates can be proposed by an electoral commitee of party congress or by at least 50 delegates to the congress (Art. 63 of Party statutes). In between the congresses, party charmain can be elected (or removed from office) by the Chief Council, by an absolute majority of the statutory number of its members.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: The motion for registration should indicate party name, its abbreviation, seat, names and addresses of people entitled to represent party and take financial obligations; party statutes and the list of at least 1000 supportering signatures.
A5RECPPGTXT: The numerical requirement of 15 members is the only condition that is required to register a party group with full privileges (klub parlamentarny).
A79CONWOMTXT: Men and women are equally represented among candidates to party positions on all levels of terrritorial organization and among delegates. Each gender should be represented in at least 35 per cent.
A81CONDELTXT:
The SLD Congress is convened by the SLD National Convention or the SLD National Council. Delegates to the SLD Congress are:
a) members of the SLD National Council,
b) members of the SLD National Audit Commission,
c) members of the SLD National Party Court,
d) delegates, elected by provincial conventions, provincial meetings, provincial councils, conventions
district or poviat councils.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Women and men are evenly represented among the candidates for the party's authorities level and delegates. Each of the sexes should be represented to a degree not lower than 35 percent.
A110EXPELTXT: non-payment of membership fees
B2BALLOTTXT: Only electoral committees. Each committee can only have 1 electoral list per district. Each list must have at least as many candidates as there are seats up for election in the district and cannot be longer than twice the number of seats up for election in the district. No list may have fewer than 35% of either females or males. Each list must be supported by at least 5000 signatures of those who have a right to vote and live in the district (some exemptions apply); parties which are registered in at least half the districts do not need to present signatures. Lists have to be filed no later than at midnight 40 day before elections. Candidates may only run in one district, and cannot run simultaneously for the Sejm (lower chamber) and Senate (upper chamber) seat. They must be at least 21 on the election day and must be a Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution).
B3CANLAW1TXT: 1) candidate must be at least 21 on the election day and must be Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution). 2) A list in a district cannot have fewer than 35% of females or males (quota).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Yes. Each list has a gender quota: there must be at least 35% male and 35% female candidates (Electoral Code).
B18CANWOMTXT: Art. 19. Women and men are evenly represented among the candidates for the party's authorities level and delegates. Each of the sexes should be represented to a degree not lower than 35 percent.
B28CANSELTXT: The National Board of SLD prepares the list of candidates, the National Council approves the lists of candidates
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Formally speaking, parties are not mentioned, only electoral commitees of a presidential candidate, which have to collected at least 100000 signatures to register a candidate.
BPRESSELTXT: The National Council decides to hold a general-party referendum regarding the election of a candidate for the President of the Republic of Poland, the National Convention grants support to the candidate for the presidential candidate
C46PLSELTXT: The SLD chairman can be elected by all SLD members through general elections. The election of the SLD  chairman in the general election is announced by the SLD National Convention or the SLD National Council by way of a resolution. Elections are conducted by the SLD National Board in accordance with electoral rules specified by National SLD Convention or National SLD Council .

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: The motion for registration should indicate party name, its abbreviation, seat, names and addresses of people entitled to represent party and take financial obligations; party statutes and the list of at least 1000 supportering signatures.

A81CONDELTXT:
Participation in the National Assembly of Delegates with the right to vote as delegates take:
a) Representatives elected by members of the Association at General Meetings in the number of one Representative of Members to one branch of the Association,
b) 5 representatives of the Parliamentary Club elected by members of the Parliamentary Club, from among the members of the Association,
c) persons who have been awarded the title of "Honorary President of the Association",
d) members of the National Board, the Audit Committee and the Disciplinary Court

Candidates may only run in one district, and cannot run simultaneously for the Sejm (lower chamber) and Senate (upper chamber) seat. B3CANLAW1TXT: 1) candidate must be at least 21 on the election day and must be Polish citizen (art. 99 ust.1 Constitution). 2) A list in a district cannot have fewer than 35% of females or males (quota).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Yes. Each list has a gender quota: there must be at least 35% male and 35% female candidates (Electoral Code).
B28CANSELTXT: The statutes of the organization does not define any rules regarding the selection of candidates in the parliamentary and European elections
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Formally speaking, parties are not mentioned, only electoral commitees of a presidential candidate, which have to collected at least 100000 signatures to register a candidate.
BPRESSELTXT: Party statutes does not mention precisely the rules of selection of a presidential candidate. it says: "The decision on the participation of the Association in the election campaigns is taken by the National Board"
C46PLSELTXT: National Assembly is responsible for every step in leader selection

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Requirements for registration: To collect 7,500 signatures of citizens-electors, a project of the party statutes, principles and/or programme, name and symbol. The Constitutional Court evaluates the legality of the application and decides over the request of official registration as political party.
A5RECPPGTXT: The Legislative party group sends a formal notification to the president of the parliament indicating the name of the group, the president and the vice-president(s). All the MPs joining the group sign the notification.
A55OTHERTXT: social democrats workers (TSD - Trabalhadores Social Democratas)
A67CONOTHER: social democrats workers (TSD - Trabalhadores Social Democratas)
A81CONDELTXT: 750 delegates to be elected by the local sections. the number of delegates each section has the right to elect depends on the number of members enrolled in the section. the members/delegates ratio is defined by party regulations. 70 delegates to be elected by the youth organisation (JSD); 70 to be elected by the workers organization (TSD) and 70 to be elected by the local public office holders organization (ASD)
A77EXCOTHER: social democrats workers (TSD - Trabalhadores Social Democratas) (the secretary-general); the president of the public local office holders organization (ASD - Autarcas Social Democratas)
A110EXPELTXT: violations of the statutes, running under opposite electoral lists; not paying the party dues for more than 2 years
B2BALLOTTXT: legal requirements: active electorate, citizenship, full political and civic rights, not to be ineligible due to specific professional conditions. the lists must contain candidates' names and identification, and a declaration of acceptance and eligibility. The same candidate cannot run in more than one electoral constituency.
B4CANLAW2TXT: lists must contain a minimum of 40% representation of each gender/ lists must not contain more than 2 candidates of the same gender consecutively
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: not applicable (parties are not mentioned)
BPRESSELTXT: Party rules only mention that the national meeting decides which individual candidacy the party officially endorses. proposal of endorsement.
C46PLSELTXT: closed primaries. the leader is directly selected by individual members which hold full voting rights (dues payment; membership lenght)

A81CONDELTXT: Delegates elected by the territorial structures must be at least 3/4 of the total number of delegates. the number of deleagtes each structure has the right to send is based on the number of members enrolled.The remaining delegates are elected by the affiliated organizations, and there are ex-officio members too.
A110EXPELTXT: violations of the statutes and members' duties; running under opposite lists

(2014). However, the process is very centralized (executive body and party leader).
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: not applicable (parties are not mentioned)
