C46PLSELTXT: The leader is elected by the party delegates at the national congress.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: Requirements for registration: To collect 7,500 signatures of citizens-electors, a project of the party statutes, principles and/or programme, name and symbol. The Constitutional Court evaluates the legality of the application and decides over the request of official registration as political party.
A5RECPPGTXT: The Legislative party group sends a formal notification to the president of the parliament indicating the name of the group, the president and the vice-president(s). All the MPs joining the group sign the notification.
A81CONDELTXT: In each district electoral assemblies are formed. The assemblies are formed according to the number of members enrolled, at least 100 members are needed to form an assembly. The ratio for electing delegates is 1 delegate each 13 members. The rules were drafted for regulating the 2018 process
A91EXCWOMTXT: principle of 50/50 gender representation in the executive body
A110EXPELTXT: violations of party statutes
B2BALLOTTXT: legal requirements: active electorate, citizenship, full political and civic rights, not to be ineligible due to specific professional conditions. the lists must contain candidates' names and identification, and a declaration of acceptance and eligibility. The same candidate cannot run in more than one electoral constituency.
B4CANLAW2TXT: lists must contain a minimum of 40% representation of each gender/ lists must not contain more than 2 candidates of the same gender consecutively
B28CANSELTXT: On proposal of the district and regional assemblies, the National Board (Mesa Nacional - ) selects the top-list candidates in the electoral districts electing 1 to 3 candidates (seats); it selects the first one fifth of the candidates in the remaining electoral districts. The remaning candidates are selected by the district/regional assemblies.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: not applicable (parties are not mentioned)
BPRESSELTXT: Party rules do not mention the process
C46PLSELTXT: No formal leadership selection. Party Statutes do not even mention this figure. The leader is rather a "coordinator" (Political Committee Coordinator). The National Board elected by the National Convention (PR system) elects on turn, among its members, a Political Committee. Normally, the coordinator of the Political Committee is the top-list member of the most voted list at the national convention

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: 1) Constituent members have to be over 18 and not have been previously charged with illicit association or with serious crimes; 2) The document of foundation must include: a) identification of the founding members; b) name of the party (cannot resemble an existing one nor contain words or expressions against people's rights and liberties; indicate the location of the party's headquarters; indicate the composition of  the temporary party organs; submit the party constitution
A5RECPPGTXT: 1. A parliamentary group may be formed by a minimum of fifteen members. A Parliamentary Group may also be formed by members of one or more political not reaching such minimum, have securedparties which, although no fewer than five seats and at least fifteen per cent of the votes in the constituencies in which they have put up a candidate, or five per cent of the votes cast in the country as a whole. 2. In no case may a separate parliamentary group be formed by members of the House belonging to the same party.
A81CONDELTXT: Allocation takes into the membership register of each provincial party branch (75%) and the results obtained in the previous election (25%). The youth organization (NNGG) also send delegates who are elected by their plenary organs. The member of the Junta Directiva of the party are ex officio members of the congress.
A110EXPELTXT: 12 months without paying the dues; joining the electoral lists of other parties; asking the vote for other parties; supporting a motion of censure without the explict authoritation of the party; losing the Spanish residency (for non-national party members); making racist, xenophobic or male chovinist public statements, bringing the name of the Party into disrepute
B2BALLOTTXT: Parties must submit a list of candidates for each district (province) to the provincial electoral authority. Candidates an only be included in one ballot. Gender provisions must be respected (see below).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Gender quota establishes that party lists must incorporate a minimum of 40 per cent and a maximum of 60 per cent of either sex into candidates lists for all elections (legislative, regional, local and European). This proportion must also be respected in each set of five candidates thus applying a double quota on the initial positions of lists.
B28CANSELTXT: Lists are elaborated by the party organization at the constituency level (the province) after receiving the suggestions of the local assemblies of party members, but the national organization can add and eliminate names and gives the formal approval to the list
C46PLSELTXT: There are two stages in the selection of the party leader. In the first stage, there is a direct vote of party members. In the second stage the party congress decides among the two most voted candidates in the first stage. In order to be an aspirant in the first stage, any party members must obtain at least 100 signatures from party members.
C87ELSELTXT: The leader of the extraparliamentary organization -the "presidente nacional"- is automatically the candidate of the party for the post of prime minister.

A4RECPARTYTXT: 1) Constituent members have to be over 18 and not have been previously charged with illicit association or with serious crimes; 2) The document of foundation must include: a) identification of the founding members; b) name of the party (cannot resemble an existing one nor contain words or expressions against people's rights and liberties; indicate the location of the party's headquarters; indicate the composition of  the temporary party organs; submit the party constitution
A5RECPPGTXT: 1. A parliamentary group may be formed by a minimum of fifteen members. A Parliamentary Group may also be formed by members of one or more political not reaching such minimum, have securedparties which, although no fewer than five seats and at least fifteen per cent of the votes in the constituencies in which they have put up a candidate, or five per cent of the votes cast in the country as a whole. 2. In no case may a separate parliamentary group be formed by members of the House belonging to the same party.
A79CONWOMTXT: Either sex is entitled to neither less than 40 per cent nor more than 60 per cent of representation in all party organs
A81CONDELTXT: Allocation takes into account the membership register of each provincial party branch. The Organizaciones sectoriales (party working groups) and the youth organization (JSE) also send delegates who are elected by their plenary organs
A91EXCWOMTXT: Neither sex shall be represented below 40% nor over 60% (neutral gender quota)
A110EXPELTXT: Six months without paying the dues; joining the electoral lists of other parties; asking the vote for other parties; supporting a motion of censure without the explict authoritation of the party
B2BALLOTTXT: Parties must submit a list of candidates for each district (province) to the provincial electoral authority. Candidates an only be included in one ballot. Gender provisions must be respected (see below).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Gender quota establishes that party lists must incorporate a minimum of 40 per cent and a maximum of 60 per cent of either sex into candidates lists for all elections (legislative, regional, local and European). This proportion must also be respected in each set of five candidates thus applying a double quota on the initial positions of lists.
B18CANWOMTXT: Party lists shall be integreted by no less than 40 per cent and no mor than 60 per cent of either sex. This provision also affects winnable positions
B28CANSELTXT: Lists are elaborated by the party organization at the constituency level (the province) after receiving the suggestions of the local assemblies of party members, but the national organization can add and eliminate names and gives the formal approval to the list
C46PLSELTXT: The party leader -secretario general- is directly elected by the direct vote of party members. In order to be able to run any aspirant must obtain at least 1% of signatures of party members.
C62ELTITLE: Candidato a la presidencia del gobierno
C87ELSELTXT: The top candidate -candidato a presidente de gobierno- is directly elected by the direct vote of party members. In order to be able to run any aspirant must obtain at least 1% of signatures of party members.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: 1) Constituent members have to be over 18 and not have been previously charged with illicit association or with serious crimes; 2) The document of foundation must include: a) identification of the founding members; b) name of the party (cannot resemble an existing one nor contain words or expressions against people's rights and liberties; indicate the location of the party's headquarters; indicate the composition of  the temporary party organs; submit the party constitution
A5RECPPGTXT: 1. A parliamentary group may be formed by a minimum of fifteen members. A Parliamentary Group may also be formed by members of one or more political not reaching such minimum, have securedparties which, although no fewer than five seats and at least fifteen per cent of the votes in the constituencies in which they have put up a candidate, or five per cent of the votes cast in the country as a whole. 2. In no case may a separate parliamentary group be formed by members of the House belonging to the same party.
A67CONOTHER: The Coordinadora General may invite non members to the Congress with voice but no right to vote.
A79CONWOMTXT: The are no specific rules, but the party principles demand gender parity in candidatures approved but the delegations.
A80CONETHTXT: The Party Statutes only encourages the promotion and visibility of minorities.
A81CONDELTXT: Article 56 states that excutive members can represent no more than the 5% of delegates. The rest of delegates must be send by the party federations, according to the number of members in each delegation and their due payments.
A91EXCWOMTXT: Gender parity must be respected regarding its members composition.
A110EXPELTXT:
a) The reiteration in the commission of serious faults previously sanctioned firmly. b) The subscription or support of a motion of censure with another party or coalition or on its own initiative, contravening agreements established by the competent bodies of IU c) The action against the agreements, decisions or resolutions expressly adopted by the organs of the organization within the framework of their competences. d) Physical aggressions against other affiliated persons. e) The serious deterioration, damage or impairment of the public image of the organization, its organs and politicians or public officials. f) Concurring in electoral candidacies, or publicly and conspicuously campaign in support of the same, when these are presented in competition with those legalized by IU or its
federated territoral organizations. g) Manipulation of the affiliate census and / or its diffusion without the corresponding authorization. h) In the case of persons appointed for public spaces and positions with any kind of remuneration failure to comply with the Charter and the Financial Agreement signed with IU or any other the Federations that integrate it. i) Failure to comply with the economic regime established by the competent body or not to which the public office is bound j) The appropriation or diversion of funds or other economic resources of IU contemplated in the present statutes (subsidies, contributions of public positions, etc). k) Commission of crimes of xenophobia, LGTBIphobia, racism, gender violence, against physical integrity, sexual, moral or psychological to women once relapse conviction on the affiliated person. l) Processed for criminal actions m) That there is a final judgment in the case of the commission of an offense that goes against the principios defended by IU. n) The abandonment or non-integration in the institutional groups constituted by the candidatures legalized by IU or its federated territorial organizations. o) Be convicted in case of corruption or misappropriation of public funds. p) The action against the agreements, decisions or resolutions expressly adopted by the organs of the organization within the framework of their competences with negative consequences for IU.
B2BALLOTTXT: Parties must submit a list of candidates for each district (province) to the provincial electoral authority. Candidates an only be included in one ballot. Gender provisions must be respected (see below).
B4CANLAW2TXT: Gender quota establishes that party lists must incorporate a minimum of 40 per cent and a maximum of 60 per cent of either sex into candidates lists for all elections (legislative, regional, local and European). This proportion must also be respected in each set of five candidates thus applying a double quota on the initial positions of lists.
B18CANWOMTXT: All candidatures must have parity composition. There can be no less than 40% women. At least 50% of districts must have a women in the first position.

C46PLSELTXT: In June 2016 a Party Congress was celebrated. In this event Party Statutes were modified. However, the part leader was previously elected. Primaries were hold to the "Consejo Político Federal" (afterwards renamed to "Asamblea Política y Social". Alberto Garzón's list won, so later on he was ratified as the new Part Leader.
C62ELTITLE: Candidato/a a la Presidencia del Gobierno
C87ELSELTXT: The Federal Presidency, after hearing the proposals of the federations and, where appropriate, the affiliates, will propose to the Federal Political Council, for its approval, the candidate for the Presidency of the Government. The Federal Political Council, in case there are other candidates besides the proposed person by the Federal Presidency, which has the endorsement of 25% of members of the Federal Political Council or of 10% of the membership, will organize the opportune consultation to the whole of the affiliation in the form of primaries.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: In order to register with the Electoral Commission parties must pay a fee, draw up a party constitution, issue a financial statement, and choose a leader, treasurer and nominating officer. Parties must supply their names, descriptions and emblems. Registered parties must ensure that all donations and loans over Â£500 come from mainly UK based sources, report donations and loans every quarter, and report weekly during a general election. Parties should also keep to campaign spending limits at elections and keep accurate records of accounts, and send the electoral commission annual accounts if income or expenditure is over Â£250,000.
A5RECPPGTXT: All MPs must swear an oath of allegiance to the monarch.
A55OTHERTXT: Alliance of Conservatives and Reformists for Europe, Friends of Israel, Middle East awareness, friends of Pakistan, LGBT+, Alumni, National property assets, friends of China, technology
A81CONDELTXT: Representatives are selcted by the consituency associations, the Scottish and Welsh parties, members of the Board and its committees, student associations and Conservative groups on local councils. Candidates, sitting parliamentarians, and the leaders of Conservative groups on local councils are also eliigble to attend and vote.
A77EXCOTHER: Members elected by the 'National Conservative Convention,' chairman of the 1922 committee, party treasurer, representatives of Conservative peers and local councillors and a representative of the party's staff
A110EXPELTXT: Standing against a party candidate
B2BALLOTTXT: If a party wishes to field candidates at elections, and have the party name appear on ballot papers, it must register formally with the Electoral Commission. Registered political parties must then comply with financial regulations and reporting requirements relating to elections, as set out in the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 ('PPERA'). These rules include donation and loan controls, spending controls during regulated elections, annual accounts reporting and annual registration confirmation. Registered parties MUST appoint the following three officers: Party Leader, Party Treasurer, Party Nominating Officer (whose task is to authorize candidates to stand on behalf of the party). A registered party is required to supply a copy of its constitution to the Electoral Commission. The Commission does not stipulate what must be in the party constitution, but it will ensure that there are no provisions that conflict with the requirements of PPERA.
B28CANSELTXT: The party board shall draw up a shortlist of candidates for consideration, which shall be put to a vote in a General Meeting of the Constituency Association
C46PLSELTXT: Candidates are narrowed down through successive rounds of voting by MPs until only two remain. The remaining candidates are then put to a vote of party members. If only one candidate is selected by MPs, there is no membership vote and this candidate is declared the winner.

A110EXPELTXT:
Party constitution states that members can be expelled for violating membership rules, which are- "(a) Members shall endorse the aims of the Party.
(b) Members shall abide by the Constitution, Rules and Standing Orders of the Party, including the Code of Conduct for Members.
(c) Members shall abide by the policy and direction of the Party.
(d) A member may not contest or be a member of any organisation contesting elections in opposition to the Party, or be a member of any organisation deemed to be a Political Party
under the Membership Rules. 
(e) A member shall have been accepted into the Party by the appropriate body, as defined in the Membership Rules. 
(f) A member shall pay a subscription to the Party in accordance with the Membership Rules."
B2BALLOTTXT: If a party wishes to field candidates at elections, and have the party name appear on ballot papers, it must register formally with the Electoral Commission. Registered political parties must then comply with financial regulations and reporting requirements relating to elections, as set out in the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 ('PPERA'). These rules include donation and loan controls, spending controls during regulated elections, annual accounts reporting and annual registration confirmation. Registered parties MUST appoint the following three officers: Party Leader, Party Treasurer, Party Nominating Officer (whose task is to authorize candidates to stand on behalf of the party). A registered party is required to supply a copy of its constitution to the Electoral Commission. The Commission does not stipulate what must be in the party constitution, but it will ensure that there are no provisions that conflict with the requirements of PPERA.
B18CANWOMTXT: "The Vetting and Selection Rules will specify processes for ensuring a balanced list of candidates, particularly in regard to gender."
B28CANSELTXT: National Executive Committee draws up a shortlist of candidates, which are voted upon by members living in that constituency.
C46PLSELTXT: "A candidate for Leader or Deputy Leader must have the nominations of at least a hundred members, who must be drawn from at least twenty Branches"

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: In order to register with the Electoral Commission parties must pay a fee, draw up a party constitution, issue a financial statement, and choose a leader, treasurer and nominating officer. Parties must supply their names, descriptions and emblems. Registered parties must ensure that all donations and loans over Â£500 come from mainly UK based sources, report donations and loans every quarter, and report weekly during a general election. Parties should also keep to campaign spending limits at elections and keep accurate records of accounts, and send the electoral commission annual accounts if income or expenditure is over Â£250,0002
A5RECPPGTXT: All MPs must swear an oath of allegiance to the monarch.
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: If a party wishes to field candidates at elections, and have the party name appear on ballot papers, it must register formally with the Electoral Commission. Registered political parties must then comply with financial regulations and reporting requirements relating to elections, as set out in the Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 ('PPERA'). These rules include donation and loan controls, spending controls during regulated elections, annual accounts reporting and annual registration confirmation. Registered parties MUST appoint the following three officers: Party Leader, Party Treasurer, Party Nominating Officer (whose task is to authorize candidates to stand on behalf of the party). A registered party is required to supply a copy of its constitution to the Electoral Commission. The Commission does not stipulate what must be in the party constitution, but it will ensure that there are no provisions that conflict with the requirements of PPERA.

A81CONDELTXT: Delegates shall be elected by local parties- however this is only if the party membership excedes 10,000 for a period of 2 years, otherwise any member can turn up and vote. Membership has now exceeded 10,000 for this period.

B28CANSELTXT: Candidates must recive nominations from two other members and a letter of permission from the regional party. Local parties then ballot their members.
C46PLSELTXT: Nominees must gain the signatures of a minimum of twenty members of the party and fill out an application form. They will then be subject to a vote of party members. Candidates may stand together as a 'job share' as long as they are not of the same sex.

B28CANSELTXT: Persons wishing to be put forward as candidates must apply to the party NEC to be placed on a list of approved candidates. If accepted, they can apply to constituency parties to be a candidate. If there are multiple candidates a vote of constituency party members will be held.
C46PLSELTXT: Applicants must apply on party website and must be supported by a proposer and 99 assentors. They must also pay a £5,000 deposit, half of which is refundable if they exceed 20% of the vote. The election is held under First Past the Post by postal ballot.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: the city and state parties need to have equal or more than 1000 members who have the address of the cities and states and then they need to have an inauguration ceremony to appoint the representative and executives. After they get a confirmation of preparatory committee for the extablishment party, they need to report the enrollment to the Electoral Commission (at the city and state levels).
A5RECPPGTXT: 20 members of the National Assembly
A79CONWOMTXT: 80% of the party congress delegates should be evenly distributed to the number of single-member districts and 20% of the party congress delegates should be distributed in proportion to the number of party members per each single-member district and the vote share that each district got from the recent general election; however, the rate should be decided by the executive committee (Dangmuwiwonhoe). Among these processes, women need to be included equal or more than 50%,
A81CONDELTXT: There is a special rule for 20 % of constituency representative seats. They will be distributed in accordance with the number of votes which each constituency got from the recent national election.
A91EXCWOMTXT: women members need to be included equal or more than 30%,
A110EXPELTXT: When party members or party employee 1) violates the party statutes. the party rules and disobeys the party decisions, or the party orders, 2) violates the party platform, 3) Violates the party ethics rules, 4) Plots harm party members or undermines the unity of party members due to false information/insults, 5) Reveals the party’s secrets, 6) Disturbs party affairs, 7) Violates the reputation of party, 8) Is charged with electoral fraud or refuses primary election results (party rule article 84.).
B2BALLOTTXT: older than 25 years; registered since 60 days or more as a resident in the district
B3CANLAW1TXT: candidate selection must be conducted democratically; 50% of representative candidates must be female; female candidates should be listed for every odd number in the party list.
B4CANLAW2TXT: 50% of representative candidates must be female; female candidates should be listed for every odd number in the party list.
B18CANWOMTXT: party leader confirms the list of candidates by recommending the Supreme Council (ch'oegowiwonhoe) through the executive member committee of the party and in this process, female candidates should be recommended by equal or more than 60%.
B28CANSELTXT: For the elections for public office, the suggesting/proposing candidats should be by primary elections that party members and non-members can participate in.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Citizens who are eligible for election to the National Assembly, and who have reached the age of forty years or more on the date of the presidential election, shall be eligible to be elected to the presidency. (Constitution Article 67(4)) (1) A political party may recommend its member as a candidate within the limit of the fixed number to be elected in each constituency in an election; (2) When any political party intends to recommend its members as candidates pursuant to paragraph (1), it shall do so according to democratic procedures (Public Official Election Act Article 47) A candidate shall apply for candidate registration in writing to the competent constituency election commission for two days from the 24th day before the election day in cases of the presidential election (Public Official Election Act Article 49) A person who applies for a candidate registration shall pay the following deposit money per candidate to the competent constituency election commission at the time of the application for registration, pursuant to Regulations of the National Election Commission: 300 million won, in cases of the presidential election; (Public Official Election Act Article 56)
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: Every political party may recommend candidates through intra-party competition to run in the elections for public offices (Public Official Election Act Article 57-2). The presidential candidate is selected by the voting results of open primary election and it should be done by 180th day before the election day in case of the presidential election, which can be changed by the executive committee’s decision if there is a significant reason. The party statue decides the way of primary election, candidate’s registration, campaign, casting, and counting a vote (Democratic Party Statute Article 100).
C46PLSELTXT: The electorates include party congress members, members who pay dues, members who do not pay dues, and non-members. The final decision should reflect the valid number of votes of party congress members and members who pay dues by 70% or more and the valid number of votes of members who do not pay dues and non-members by 30% or more.
C87ELSELTXT: The selection process is not by an election, but the executive committee members decide the position.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: the city and state parties need to have equal or more than 1000 members who have the address of the cities and states and then they need to have an inauguration ceremony to appoint the representative and executives. After they get a confirmation of preparatory committee for the extablishment party, they need to report the enrollment to the Electoral Commission (at the city and state levels).
A5RECPPGTXT: 20 members of the National Assembly
A79CONWOMTXT: The party members who were recommended by the members of National Assembly and the party members who were recommended by Dang-won-hyup-eu-hoe(party’s smallest functional unit, see A47) and decided by the state/regional party branches need to be more than 50% of all the delegates to the party congress. Among the party members above, women need to be included equal or more than 50%
A81CONDELTXT: The party members who were recommended by the members of National Assembly (sub-paragraph #18) and the party members who were recommended by Dang-won-hyup-eu-hoe(party’s smallest functional unit, see A47) and decided by the local party branches (sub-paragraph #17) need to be more than 50% of all the delegates to the party congress. Among the party members described in the sub-paragraph #17, delegates representing the special vocations, disabled people, and netizens need to be included. Among the party members decribed in the sub-paragraph #17 and #18, people younger than 45 years old need to be included equal or more than 20% and equal or less than 40%.
A91EXCWOMTXT: The candidate is required to be a party member at the time of application. However, exceptions could apply to a new member by the request of the candidates recommendation committee and decision of the Spreme Coulcil
A110EXPELTXT: When the party member of National Assembly 1) abuses his/her authority or does influence peddling, 2) Employs aides among his/her own or his/her spouse’s relatives, 3) is involved in graft or accepting bribes, 4) redeems salary from his/her employees or illegally accepts money like donations, 5) fails to perform or avoids his/her duties on interest conflicts, 6) violates his/her dignity as to official business.
B2BALLOTTXT: older than 25 years; registered since 60 days or more as a resident in the district
B3CANLAW1TXT: candidate selection must be conducted democratically; 50% of representative candidates must be female; female candidates should be listed for every odd number in the party list.
B4CANLAW2TXT: 50% of representative candidates must be female; female candidates should be listed for every odd number in the party list.
B18CANWOMTXT: 50% of candidates for the list of proportional representatives must be female; female candidates should be listed for every other number in the party list.
B28CANSELTXT: The public nomination committee controls the intra-party candidate selection procedures for the public offices. Specifically about screening candidates, the national jury consisting of the 50 general public evaluate candidates' disqualifications. The final suggestions of candidates are made by the public nomination committee, which is subject to confirmation by the Supreme Council. However, when the candidate suggestions are re-approved by a two-thirds majority of the public nomination committee, the Supreme Council should follow the decision. Once the suggestion process is finalized, the party leader officially announces the results.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Citizens who are eligible for election to the National Assembly, and who have reached the age of forty years or more on the date of the presidential election, shall be eligible to be elected to the presidency. (Constitution Article 67(4)) (1) A political party may recommend its member as a candidate within the limit of the fixed number to be elected in each constituency in an election; (2) When any political party intends to recommend its members as candidates pursuant to paragraph (1), it shall do so according to democratic procedures (Public Official Election Act Article 47) A candidate shall apply for candidate registration in writing to the competent constituency election commission for two days from the 24th day before the election day in cases of the presidential election (Public Official Election Act Article 49)  A person who applies for a candidate registration shall pay the following deposit money per candidate to the competent constituency election commission at the time of the application for registration, pursuant to Regulations of the National Election Commission: 300 million won, in cases of the presidential election;  (Public Official Election Act Article 56)
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: Every political party may recommend candidates through intra-party competition to run in the elections for public offices (Public Official Election Act Article 57-2). The presidential candidate is selected by the voting results of the national participation electoral college (80%) and the results of public opinion poll (20%) (Liberty Korea Party Statute Article 99)
C46PLSELTXT: The party leader is decided by the votes from the electorates (70%) and the results from the public survey (30%). The electorate includes party congress members, members who pay dues, members who do not pay dues. The survey may include non-members.
C87ELSELTXT: The selection process is not by an election, but the executive committee members decide the position.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT:
The Political Fund Control Act stipulates that it is necesssary for a party to have more than 5 diet members, or to have one diet member and receive more than 2% of votes in recent national elections, in order to be recognized as a party.
The Political Party Subsidies Act stipulates that it is necesssary for a party to have more than 5 diet members, or to have one diet member and receive more than 2% of votes in recent national elections, in order to get funded.
A5RECPPGTXT: More than two diet members can organize Legislative party groups, but the Diet Act needs at leaset 20 (10) members to submit bills in the Lower (Upper) house.
A79CONWOMTXT: A prefectural party federation branch selects four delegates, two of whom should be members of party youth and female organizations, respectively.
A81CONDELTXT: The party convention shall consist of members with the following qualifications: all party diet members and four delegates from each prefectural federation of party branches.
A110EXPELTXT: Disrupting party's discipline, damaging reputes of members of the party such as criminal cases, revolt against party's decision
B2BALLOTTXT:
The Public Offices Election Act stipulates that it is necesssary for a party to have more than 5 diet members, or to receive more than 2% of votes in recent national elections, in order to nominate candidates for the single member districts.
The Public Offices Election Act stipulates that it is necesssary for a party to have more than 5 diet members, or to receive more than 2% of votes in recent national elections, or to run candidates more than 20% of the number of seats elected, in order to nominate candidates for the PR districts.
B28CANSELTXT: No rules to be mentioned
C46PLSELTXT:
When there is only one candidate for the President, no voting is held and the candidate becomes the winner.
If there is more than one candidate, those who obtained a majority of the valid vote of the Diet members' ballots 
and the total of Party member calculated ballots shall be declared elected（LDP rules for election of President, Art.22）．
If no candidate receives majorities of valid votes on the first ballot, the final vote by the Diet members and 47 prefectures' votes 
shall be held between the two highest ranked candidates. Those who obtained more votes than the other shall be declared elected(Ibid.,Art.23).

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: 1.- Support from at least 101 voters from at least one third of Brazilian states. Party manifesto, institutional rules and the results of the national election of provisional leaders should be published in the Official Diary. 2 -Registry in the Civil Registry Office of the Federal Capital. 3 - Inform the regional Electoral Management Bodies the composition of the provisional commission or persons responsible of the presentation of lists or supporting signatures. 4. Proof of support of voters not affiliated to the party with signatures equivalent to 0.5% of the votes in the last leguslative election 5 - Municipal and regional governing bodies in at least on third of the states and the provisional national direction board. 6 - Registry of regional bodies in the regional Electoral Courts. 7 - Registry of institucional rules of the party and the nacional direction board in the Top Electoral Court:arts. 7, 8 and 9 of the Law Nº 9.096 / 95 and 8 a 35 of the resolution – Electoral Supreme CourtN ° 23.282 / 10
A5RECPPGTXT: Same answer that the previous question A4RECPARTYTXT. There is no difference in Brazil between these two questions

A110EXPELTXT: 1 - Infraccion of the postulate or the program devices, the ethic codes, or the statute, or for desrespecting the politic orientation fixed by the competent organ; 2 - disobedience to the deliberations regularly taken on matters considered as fundamental, including those who the bench to which the occupying legislative office belongs, and also, the holders of executive positions; 3 - violation of the free exercise of the right to vote, the normality of elections, or the right to party affiliation; 4 - improbity in the exercise of parliamentary or executive mandate, as well as that of a party organ or administrative function; 5 - political activity contrary to the democratic regime or Party interests; 6 - lack, without justified reason, in writing, more than 3 (three) successive meetings of the party organ of which it is part; 7 - lack of exation in the fulfillment of the duties related to the party functions; 8 - support a candidate other than that adopted by the competent party body.

VII - party infidelity, under the terms of the law and these Bylaws; VIII - failure to comply with the deliberations of the Party Meetings and Congresses, as well as those adopted by the Executive Directorates and Committees of the Party, especially if, having been summoned, they did not participate; X - agreements or alliances that contravene the interests of the Party, especially with affiliates or affiliates of parties not supported by party leadership; XI - support to governments that contravene the Party's programmatic principles, especially when for personal gain, or the exercise of government office - minister or minister, secretary or secretary, director or director of autarchy or similar - at any level, in government not supported by the PT, unless expressly authorized by the party bodies; XII - obstruction of the operation of any party governing body; XIII - the promotion of block affiliations aimed at the predominance of individuals or groups alien or unfamiliar with the Party; XIV - the non-communication to all the affiliates and affiliates of the names inscribed on the plates; the non-registration of membership records; the non-disclosure of the list of affiliates and affiliates to the Party as a whole; the impediment, by act or omission, of the application of norms or supervision in the internal electoral processes; the collective payment of the contribution of affiliates and affiliates, or impediment to the participation of any affiliated or affiliated duly authorized in their instance; XV - the formulation of unfounded denunciations against other affiliates or members of the Party; Once the election has been carried out, the percentage of the sexes resulting from the elected communal presidents and the elected elective delegates will be computed. B2BALLOTTXT: Candidates will be affiliated to a political party, at least two months before the expiration of the deadline for submitting candidacies and have not been affiliated to another political party in the past nine months of the deadline. B3CANLAW1TXT: There is an organic constitutional law (N° 20.640) which establishes the requierements por the primaries in every political party. B4CANLAW2TXT: The voting and scrutiny law and the candidate selection law establish gender regulations. The first indicate that the declarations of candidacies to deputy, the male or female candidacies can't exceed sixty percent of the total. This percentage will be mandatory and will be calculated independently of the nomination form of the candidatures. The second law indicate that political parties whose statutes provide affirmative action measures will proceed according to them when selecting their candidacies for the primary elections.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: The political constitution establishes that candidates must comply the following requeriments:Chilean nationality; thirty-five years of minimum age and be a citizen with the right to vote. The voting and scrutiny law establishes that candidates must present a declaration of candidacy and government programs. The declaration of candidacies by the political parties must be constituted in all regions of the country or accredit a total number of affiliates in the regions in which they are legally constituted not less than 0.5 percent.
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: the constitution establishes that the parties may use (voluntarily) primary for the presidential candidates selection. The primaries law states that primaries may be held by a party, by electoral pact between parties and / or with independents.

A81CONDELTXT:
General Assembly of HDZ consists of:
a) members of central party bodies,
b) members of the Croatian and European Parliament, if members of HDZ,
c) members of the Cabinet (Prime Minister and ministers), if members of HDZ,
d) delegates of municipal/city party organizations and regional party organizations, who make at least 50% of the General Assambly members,
e) delegates of party organizations from abroad,
f) presidents of regional party organizations, regional prefects, presidents of regional assamblies, presidents of party fractions in regional assamblies, if members of HDZ,
g) delegates of the HDZ Youth,
h) delegates of other HDZ communities (women, seniors ..).
A110EXPELTXT: - other party membership; nomination in elections without party consent; resignation from public office without party consent; in the case of final court sentence for criminal acts listed in the Ethical Codex of the party; heavier violation of membership duties (acting with consequences for party reputation or interests, rude breach of party Statutes or Ethical Codex, acting contrary to party program, principles and party structure)

B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Candidates in presidential elections have to be at least 18 year old Croatian citizens. Parties, coalitions of parties or voters (independent candidates) nominate candidates. Candidates have to collect at least 10,000 signatures in order to be officially recognized by Electoral Commission.
C46PLSELTXT: Candidates for party leader have to collect at least 5000 signatures of party members within 13 days. Each member can support more than one candidate. After checking the signatures, the Party Electoral Committee confirms the list of candidates.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: A political party is defined as a committee or organization whose candidates for federal office appear on the ballots as the party's candidate and ballot access is controled by the states. National Party committess must register with the Federal Election Committe within 10 days of raising or spending more than $1000.
A55OTHERTXT: Governor's Association; Democratic Mayors; Democratic Legislative Campaign Committee; Democratic Municipal Officials Conference; College Democrats; State Treasurers; Lieutenant Governers; Association of Secretatries of State; Attorneys General Association
A67CONOTHER: Yes, all listed above are invited delegates
A79CONWOMTXT: Delegates should be equally divided between men and women
A81CONDELTXT: All additional delegates that are not members of the Democratic National Committee are "Fairly approtioned and openly selected" by state party comittees
A110EXPELTXT: members are required to maintain residence in the jurisdiction represented by the member and affirm support for the democratic Presidential and VIce Presidential nominees and must meet minimum attendence requirements
B2BALLOTTXT: Access to ballots is decentralized and controlled by the states
B3CANLAW1TXT: There are no federal regulations. States regulate the selection of candidates.
B28CANSELTXT: Each state party sets rules for primary elections and selection/endorsement of candidates. This is not done by the federal party for legisltaive elections
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Ballot access is controlled by the state level governments
BPRESSELTXT: The Democratic National Committee holds a convention in presidential election years where the presidential candidate is choses. Delegates to the convention include members of the DNC, including high ranking Democrats (president and vice president, if applicable), all current representatives and senators, democratic governers and former high ranking party figures (past presidents, vice presidents, speakers of the house, etc. ) These people are reconginzed as unpledged delegates unless they have publically supported another party's presidential candidate. The US state are all apportioned a specific number of pledged delegates that are pledged to a specific candidates through a state definied process (primary, etc.). All delegates than vote on the potential presidential candidates.
C46PLSELTXT: The designation of political leader of the party is not a clear process in US parties
C87ELSELTXT: The party's main electoral leader is chosen at the national presidential convention by delegates selected at the state level. These voting preference of these delegates is determined by state rules related to the primary voting process

B2BALLOTTXT: The candidates should be Greek citizens of at least 25 years old
B4CANLAW2TXT: At least one third of the candidates should be women

B28CANSELTXT: The Secretary of the Central Political Committee and the Political Council of the party propose the creation of a candidate selection committee. This committee receives the proposals for candidates and organizes primary elections in every electoral district for their selections. In the primary elections participate the party members and registerd supporters. In the case of snap elections, the candidate selection committee deliberates with local and regional organs and selects the party candidates. The candidacies need the approval of the central political committee.
C46PLSELTXT: The candidate must be proposed: a) at least by the one fourth of the Central Political Committee members; b) at least by the one third of the regional and prefectural committees; c) at least by the 10% of party members. The leader is selected by the members and registered supporters in an open primary.

A candidate cannot have been legaly convicted of a criminal activity. A candidate cannot be under sentence.  A candidate must be legally competent
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: parties are not mentioned
B36PRESCANLAWTXT: Za prezidenta možno zvoliť každého občana SR, ktorý je voliteľný za poslanca NRSR a v deň voľby dosiahol vek 40 rokov. Kandidáta na prezidenta navrhuje najmenej 15 poslancov NRSR alebo občania, ktorí majú právo voliť do NRSR, a to na základe petície podpísanej najmenej 15 000 občanmi. Návrhy na voľbu sa odovzdávajú predsedovi NRSR najneskôr do 21 dní od vyhlásenia volieb./Candidates eligible for the presidency include any citizen of the Slovak Republic who is considered elegible for election to the National Council of Slovakia and who on the day of the election is at least 40 years old.  Candidates for president must be nominated by at least 15 deputies of the National Council of the Slovak Republic or on the basis of petitions signed by at least 15,000 citizens.  Nominations for election must be submitted to the President of the National Council of the Slovak Republic within 21 days of the announcement of the election.

A81CONDELTXT: Volí sa 200 delegátov, v prípade existencie parlamentného poslaneckého klubu strany 300 delegátov. Členovia predsedníctva strany z príslušného okresu a okresný predseda majú právo účasti na sneme zo svojej funkcie. Delegáti z okresov sú volení okresnými konferenciami podľa kľúča, ktorý určí Republiková rada./200 delegates are elected and in the case of the existence of a parliamentary deputy club the number is 300.  Members of the sub-regional presidiums of the party and sub-regional presidents have the right to participate in the conference by virtue of their party function.  Delegates from sub-regions are elected by subregional conferences according to a method which is determined by the Republic-level council.
A110EXPELTXT: ak na návrh Republikovej komisie pre etické otázky a dohľad nad stanovami zruší členstvo Republiková rada (návrh na vylúčenie je podaný ak člen: podporovoal nezávislého kandidáta alebo kandidáta inej strany, ktorý vystupoval proti kandidátovi strany, hlásal názory, ktoré sú v protiklade so základnými ideálmi strany a konal proti základným cieľom strany a tým porušil stanovy strany, v trestnoprávnom konaní bol súdom za úmyselný trestný čin právoplatne odsúdený, sfalšoval dokument strany alebo zverejnil vnútorný stranícky dokument alebo dokument podliehajúci ochrane údajov), ak člen vystúpi alebo ho vylúčia z poslaneckého klubu SMK na úrovni miestnej, krajskej, parlamentnej alebo európskej parlamentnej/if on the proposal of the Republic-level commission for ethical questions and oversight of the statutes, the Repbulic-level council cancels membership (the propsal for exclusion is delivered if a member: supports an independent candidate or candidats of another party who campaign against a candidate of the party, voices opinions which are in conflict with the basic ideals of the party and acts agains t the basic goals of the party and thereby violates the stattues of the party, is legally convicted by a court for criminal behavior in an intentional criminal act, falsifies documents of the party or publishes internal party documents or a document contaning sensitive information); if a member leaves or is excluded from the deputy club of SMK at the local, regional parliamentary or European parliament level.

A4RECPARTYTXT: To register as a political party at the national level, South African parties must: register with the Independent Electoral Commission, which involves submitting an application, party name, copy of the Party's constitution, Deed of Foundation (signed by 500 registered voters), two sets of party logo/symbol in colour; R500 registration fee; hard copy of the Government Gazette in which their Notice appears.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be registered as an offical party as per A4RECPARTYTXT and have won enough votes to have at least one seat
A81CONDELTXT:
At least 90% (ninety per cent) of the delegates at Conference shall be from Branches, elected at
properly constituted Branch General Meetings. The number of delegates per Branch shall be in proportion to
their paid up membership, provided that each Branch in good standing shall be entitled to at least 1 (one)
delegate; All members of the National Executive Committee shall attend, ex officio, as full participants in, and
as delegates to, the Conference; and The remainder of the voting delegates at the Conference shall be allocated by the NEC from among members of the Provincial Executive Committees, the ANC Veterans’ League, the ANC Youth League and the
ANC Women’s League. It also has a provision for non-voting delegates who can participate based on special invitation
A91EXCWOMTXT: No less than 50% of delegates have to be women
B2BALLOTTXT: Parties must be registered (To register as a political party at the national level, South African parties must: register with the Independent Electoral Commission, which involves submitting an application, party name, copy of the Party's constitution, Deed of Foundation (signed by 500 registered voters), two sets of party logo/symbol in colour; R500 registration fee; hard copy of the Government Gazette in which their Notice appears). They must also submit a list of candidates to the chief electoral officer not later than the date stated in the election timetable. The list of candidates must be accompanied by a prescribed undertaking binding the party to the Code; a declaration that each candidate is qualified to stand of election in terms of the Constitution; an acceptance of nomination signed by each candidate; an undertaking signed by each candidate that they will be bound by the code; and a deposit for the amount prescribed by the Electoral Commission
B18CANWOMTXT: Branch nomination lists must adhere to the criteria set out in paragraph 26 related to 50% women, representivity and at least 60% or more sitting MPs/MPLs. Expertise and specialist skills must also be factored in when considering nominations.
C46PLSELTXT: https://www.sahistory.org.za/archive/information-sheet-nec-nominations-anc-october-2007-52nd-national-conference-polokwane

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: To register as a political party at the national level, South African parties must: register with the Independent Electoral Commission, which involves submitting an application, party name, copy of the Party's constitution, Deed of Foundation (signed by 500 registered voters), two sets of party logo/symbol in colour; R500 registration fee; hard copy of the Government Gazette in which their Notice appears.
A5RECPPGTXT: Must be registered as an offical party as per A4RECPARTYTXT and have won enough votes to have at least one seat
A81CONDELTXT: Delegates are made up of: Leader, Federal Chairperson, the three Deputy Federal Chairpersons, Chairperson and Deputy Chairperson of the Federal Council, Federal Chairperson of Finance, CEO with voting rights, any co-opted members of the Feeral Executive, the Provincial leader, one Deputy Provincial Leader and the Provincial Chairperson (if any) per province, all Members of Parliament, all Members of Provincial Legislatures, local government councillors equal to five times the number of MPs and MPLs inthe country (allocated to the provinces on the basis of the proportion of votes obtained by the party in that province in the last nation-wide election),  branch representatives (not less than 35% of the total Congress delegates), Federal Leader, Chairperson and Provincial Chairpersons of the Democratic Alliance Youth and Democratic Alliance Women's Network; Chairperson of the Association of Democratic Alliance Councillors or his nominee, DA Abroad leader or his nominee, 9 other delegates from DA Abroad, other persons invited by the Leader or Federal Chairperson with approval of the Federal Council (non-voting delegates), any members of the Federal Council who are not otherwise delegates.
A110EXPELTXT: Publicly opposing the Party's principles or repeatedly opposing policies except in or through appropriate Party structures; deliberately acting in ways that impact negatively on the Party; being found guilty of a serious criminal offence by a court; failing to carry out duties; bringing the name of the Party into disrepute or harming the interests of the Party; acting in an unreasonable manner and/or endangering cooperation within the Party; rejecting or failing to comply with Party decisions; membership fraud; financial misuse; mobilizes opposition to the Party or Party policy; discrimination; publicly alleges prejudice on the part of the Party; intimidates or harasses any Party member or staff member; discloses confidential information; if a public representative - disparages any member of the Party or another Party.
B1LEGLDRTXT: Helen Zille (also known as Otta Helene Maree)
B2BALLOTTXT: Parties must be registered (To register as a political party at the national level, South African parties must: register with the Independent Electoral Commission, which involves submitting an application, party name, copy of the Party's constitution, Deed of Foundation (signed by 500 registered voters), two sets of party logo/symbol in colour; R500 registration fee; hard copy of the Government Gazette in which their Notice appears). They must also submit a list of candidates to the chief electoral officer not later than the date stated in the election timetable. The list of candidates must be accompanied by a prescribed undertaking binding the party to the Code; a declaration that each candidate is qualified to stand of election in terms of the Constitution; an acceptance of nomination signed by each candidate; an undertaking signed by each candidate that they will be bound by the code; and a deposit for the amount prescribed by the Electoral Commision
B28CANSELTXT: The DA constitution just states that candidates must be members in good standing and that the Federal Council is responsible for setting the rules for nomination and selection, while the Leader and branches play a role (unspecified) in candidate selection. The DA accepts self-nomination of candidates via a formal process (usually advertized on its website and often in local newspapers). Prospective candidates then go through a training and mentoring scheme, before selection decisions are made. Details of how this is done are not made public. There is a DA selection panel: https://www.iol.co.za/capetimes/news/zilles-return-to-da-selection-panel-ruffles-feathers-16183588
C46PLSELTXT: The publicly available rules state that the Leader is elected by the Federal Congress. Newspaper reports indicate this is done via a secret ballot of all delegates.

TITLE: Political Party Database
A4RECPARTYTXT: 500 members are needed to register a party. A member is at least 18-year-old voting-capable Estonian citizen or a citizen of European Union member state who is not Estonian citizen but who permanently lives in Estonia. A member belongs to one party at once. Party membership is denied for following occupations: Chancellor of Justice and advisors to Chancellor of Justice, Auditor General and Director of Audit, judge, prosecutor, police officer, military regular personnel, president during the term of presidency.
A5RECPPGTXT: A legislative party group can be formed among members of parliament who were elected from one electoral list (only parties can have electoral lists at the elections) and it must have at least 5 members. A member of parliament can belong to one faction and it is not possible to change factions during a parliamentary term.
A81CONDELTXT: No rules
B2BALLOTTXT: Only parties that have been officially registered at least 90 days before elections can participate in parliamentary elections. Designated party representatives present candidate lists, candidacy documents, individual applications for each candidate, and proof of security payments to the National Electoral Committee to formally nominate candidates. Security must be paid prior presenting necessary documents, which is the size of minimum monthly salary. Party presents national and district lists; candidates have to be presented in both of these lists. The maximum number of candidates in the national list is 125. The maximum number of candidates in disctrict list is equivalent to the number of district mandates plus up to two candidates. A candidate can be at least 21-year-old citizen of Estonia who is capable of voting. Restrictions for candidacy are held for military regular personnel and people who serve sentence in a penal institution (sentence has to be enforced). A person can stand as a candidate in only one electoral district and in a list of one party, electoral coalition or as an independent candidate. Only a member of a party or an independent candidate can stand as a candidate in a list of one political party. Candidates and the organisation of the lists are up to inner-party decisions.
C46PLSELTXT: Every individual member has the right to run for party leader and the leader is elected by the party congress (in recent years electronically).

B2BALLOTTXT: Legal requirements for legislative elections ballot access stem from Article 67 of the National Constitution of 1977 which stipulates that for a candidate to qualify for nomination or appointment to run as an MP she/he must meet the following: is a citizen of the United Republic who has attained the age of twenty-one years and who can read and write in Kiswahili or English; and is a member and a candidate proposed by a political party. Furthermore, such person must not possess or voluntarily acquire citizenship of any other country; in accordance with a law applicable in the United Republic, it has been formally certified that such person is not of unsound mind; such person has not been convicted by any court in the United Republic and sentenced to death or to a term of imprisonment exceeding six months for any offence however styled involving dishonesty; within a period of five years preceding the date of a general election, such person has not been convicted and sentenced to imprisonment for an offence involving dishonesty or for contravening the law concerning ethics of public leaders; such person has no an interest in any Government contract of any kind in respect of which special restrictions are prescribed by Act of Parliament and he has not contravened such restrictions; such person does not hold a senior office in the service of the Government of the United Republic, not being an office of which the President may or is required to appoint a Member of Parliament in accordance with this Constitution or a law enacted by Parliament; or in accordance with a law enacted by Parliament dealing with offences concerning election of any kind such person has not been disqualified from registering as a voter or from voting in a Parliamentary election. A person shall not be competent to contest for election as a constituency Member of Parliament at any general election if he is at the same time contesting for election to the office of President, nor shall he be competent to contest for election as a Member of Parliament at any by-election if he is President.
B3CANLAW1TXT: No public regulations of parties’ nomination rules
B28CANSELTXT: The initial process starts at the district/constitency level for selection of names, then forward to the National Executive Council for approval
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Legal requirements for Presidential elections ballot access stem from Article 39 of the National Constitution of 1977 which stipulates that for a candidate to qualify for nomination or appointment to run as Presidential Candidate in the Presidential elections she/he must meet the following: is a citizen of the United Republic by birth in accordance with the citizenship law; has attained the age of forty years; is a member of, and a candidate nominated by, a political party; is qualified to be a Member of Parliament or a Member of the House of Representatives; within the period of five years before the General Elections, he has not been convicted by any court for any offence relating to evasion to pay any tax due to the Government; both of the parents are Tanzanian citizens by birth. The Party General Secretary to provide a letter of introduction of the candidate for him/her to submit to the Commission of Elections. The letter should include confirmation that he/she is a party member and that he qualifies to ran for the presidency
BPRESSELTXT: The Presidential candidates are filtered by the Executive Council then after their names are taken to the National Congress for voting.
C46PLSELTXT: The leadership selection starts at the primary level going higher. Thus, the selection involves various members at different levels of party structure.
C87ELSELTXT: The presidential candidate, who is the electoral leader at national level is selected at the national level - three main bodies are involved : the congress (general assembly); the Executive Committee and the Executive Council.

A78CONFREQ: No public regulations of parties’ nomination rules
A105WEBTLK2: Party rules that govern candidate selection emanates from the Party Regulations for Nominating Candidates in State Offices of 2005. The 'Regulations' indicate the following: A candidate must fill special application form prepared for this purpose, collected from District Party Secretary; then deposits a total of Tshs.100, 000/= application fee; then the filtering and screening process is conducted by a special political committee of the party at District and Regional level; then a party primary for selecting candidates is hold at a special Party Constituent Congress where the winner is decided by simple majority; then further scrutiny of candidates proceeds at Party’s Central Committee, and forward the names plus recommendations to the Party’s NEC for final selection and nomination.
B3CANLAW1TXT: Legal requirements for Presidential elections ballot access stem from Article 39 of the National Constitution of 1977 which stipulates that for a candidate to qualify for nomination or appointment to run as Presidential Candidate in the Presidential elections she/he must meet the following: is a citizen of the United Republic by birth in accordance with the citizenship law; has attained the age of forty years; is a member of, and a candidate nominated by, a political party; is qualified to be a Member of Parliament or a Member of the House of Representatives; within the period of five years before the General Elections, he has not been convicted by any court for any offence relating to evasion to pay any tax due to the Government; both of the parents are Tanzanian citizens by birth. The Party General Secretary to provide a letter of introduction of the candidate for him/her to submit to the Commission of Elections. The letter should include confirmation that he/she is a party member and that he qualifies to ran for the presidency
B25BCANSELD: Party rules that govern selection of the party's presidential nominee emanate from the  Party Procedures for Nominating Candidates in State Offices of 2005. The 'Procedures' indicate the following: A candidate must fill special application form, and must obtain signatures of 250 trustees (members) from at least 10 regions, and at least two of the regions from Tanzania Zanzibar (Delegates of Party Congress or National Executve Committee are not allowed to be candidate's trustees); The Central Committee shall filter and recommend not more than 5 names of the candidates to the National Executve Committee; then the National Executve Committee shall filter and forward not more than 3 names to the Party National Congress for final selection and nomination.
C6REF6B: For a candidate to qualify for nomination or selection for the party leadership position, s/he must meet the following conditions: must possess party membership; her/his membership should not be of any doubt whatsoever; must meet all terms and conditions of party membership as per the provisions of Article 8 of the CCM Constitution; must be duly exercising the memebrship duties as per the provisions of Article 15 of the CCM Constitution; must subscribe wholly with the party ideology of Socialism and Self-reliance; and must possess extraordinary leadership qualities for the contested position; and must have leadership background and experience.
C40PLVT2: Party rules that govern selection of the party's presidential nominee emanate from the  Code of Nomination of Candidates in State Offices of 2009. The 'Code' indicates the following: A candidate must fill special application form, and must obtain signatures of 250 trustees (members) from at least 10 regions, and at least two of the regions from Tanzania Zanzibar (Delegates of Party Congress or National Executve Committee are not allowed to be candidate's trustees); The Central Committee shall filter and recommend not more than 5 names of the candidates to the National Executve Committee; then the National Executve Committee shall filter and forward not more than 3 names to the Party National Congress for final selection and nomination.

A81CONDELTXT: The General Conference shall be attended by: (a) all members of the National Council; (b) up to 600 delegates from each Province selected in accordance with the rules made by the Central Committee.
B2BALLOTTXT: 13. (1) It shall be the duty of the returning officer for a constituency to provide nomination papers to persons who are qualified for nomination and who request for such papers. Nomination for election The Laws of Zambia Copyright Ministry of Legal Affairs, Government of the Republic of Zambia (2) Every person who desires to be a candidate for election in any constituency shall lodge with the returning officer for that constituency his nomination paper in accordance with the provisions of this Part. (3) The nomination paper referred to in sub-regulation (2) shall be in Form GEN 2 set out in the Schedule hereto and shall- (a) state the name of the political party of which the candidate is the authorised candidate or, if he is not the authorised candidate of any political party, that he is standing as an independent candidate; (b) be completed in all respects, save that the supporters shall sign it in the presence of the returning officer; (c) be signed by the candidate or by any person authorised in that behalf by him in writing: Provided that if the nomination paper is signed on behalf of the candidate, a copy of the written authority shall be attached thereto; (d) State the name and address of his election agent, if any; (e) be lodged within the period appointed for that purpose in respect of such constituency; (f) be accompanied by an election fee in the sum of twenty thousand kwacha which fee shall not be refunded once the nomination has been lodged; (g) be accompanied by a declaration in Form GEN 3 set out in the Schedule hereto which the declarant has made and subscribed before a magistrate. (4) At the time of lodging a nomination paper, the candidate, or a person duly authorised by him, shall present himself to the returning officer together with his nine supporters who shall produce their voters registration cards and national registration cards to the returning officer. The supporters shall complete that part of the nomination paper which relates to their signatures in the presence of the returning officer.
B28CANSELTXT: Every candidate in Party (other than Party Presidential and Central Committee elections), Parliamentary and Local Government elections shall be subject to prior approval by Central Committee. No person shall stand as a candidate for any Party, Parliamentary or Local Administration elections unless he or she is a member of the Party. The Central Committee's approval of the candidacy shall be evidenced by a certificate of approval signed by the Secretary-General. The decision of the Central Committee in this Regard shall be final. After approval, the Central Committee shall send names of the approved candidates to the Electoral Commission.
B35PRESBALLOTTXT: Parties not mentioned
BPRESSELTXT:
(1) The President of the Party shall be elected at the General Conference of the Party.
(2) A candidate shall indicate to the Secretary-General of the Party his intention to stand for the Office of the President of the Party not less than one day before the date of the General Conference.
(4) The Secretary General of the Party shall submit the name or names of the candidates of the Central Committee for consideration and where there is more than one candidate the Central Committee may indicate support for one of the candidates.
(5) The Central Committee shall submit the name of the candidate or candidates to the National Council for approval or disapproval.
(6) The person whose candidature for the office is not approved by the National Council shall not be Eligible for election at the General Conference for the office of the President of the Party. 
(7) A candidate whose candidature for the office of the President of the Party is approved by the National Council shall lodge his nomination papers with the Returning Officer appointed by the Electoral Commission supported by twenty (20) delegates from each of the Provinces of Zambia attending the General Conference.
(8) If more than one candidate stand for the office of the President of the Party, each delegate to the General Conference shall vote for one candidate only and the candidate who receives the greatest number of votes shall be the sole candidate for election to the office of the President of the Republic.
(9) Where only one candidate has filed nomination papers at the close of nomination, such a Candidate shall be declared duly elected President of the Party without conducting a poll.
(10) A member of the Party shall not be qualified as a candidate for the office of the President of the Party unless he has been a member of the Party for five (5) years immediately preceding the nomination and he is qualified under the Constitution of Zambia for election to the office of the President of Zambia.
(11) If the person elected as President of the Party is not elected as President of the Republic he shall Continue to be President of the Party until a President of the Party is elected at another extra ordinary General Conference.
C46PLSELTXT:
(1) The President of the Party shall be elected at the General Conference of the Party.
(2) A candidate shall indicate to the Secretary-General of the Party his intention to stand for the Office of the President of the Party not less than one day before the date of the General Conference.
(4) The Secretary General of the Party shall submit the name or names of the candidates of the Central Committee for consideration and where there is more than one candidate the Central Committee may indicate support for one of the candidates.
(5) The Central Committee shall submit the name of the candidate or candidates to the National Council for approval or disapproval.
(6) The person whose candidature for the office is not approved by the National Council shall not be Eligible for election at the General Conference for the office of the President of the Party.
(7) A candidate whose candidature for the office of the President of the Party is approved by the National Council shall lodge his nomination papers with the Returning Officer appointed by the Electoral Commission supported by twenty (20) delegates from each of the Provinces of Zambia attending the General Conference.
(8) If more than one candidate stand for the office of the President of the Party, each delegate to the General Conference shall vote for one candidate only and the candidate who receives the greatest number of votes shall be the sole candidate for election to the office of the President of the Republic.
(9) Where only one candidate has filed nomination papers at the close of nomination, such a Candidate shall be declared duly elected President of the Party without conducting a poll.
(10) A member of the Party shall not be qualified as a candidate for the office of the President of the Party unless he has been a member of the Party for five (5) years immediately preceding the nomination and he is qualified under the Constitution of Zambia for election to the office of the President of Zambia.
(11) If the person elected as President of the Party is not elected as President of the Republic he shall Continue to be President of the Party until a President of the Party is elected at another extra ordinary General Conference.

CR27_1REVMBRTOT: 13. (1) It shall be the duty of the returning officer for a constituency to provide nomination papers to persons who are qualified for nomination and who request for such papers. Nomination for election The Laws of Zambia Copyright Ministry of Legal Affairs, Government of the Republic of Zambia (2) Every person who desires to be a candidate for election in any constituency shall lodge with the returning officer for that constituency his nomination paper in accordance with the provisions of this Part. (3) The nomination paper referred to in sub-regulation (2) shall be in Form GEN 2 set out in the Schedule hereto and shall- (a) state the name of the political party of which the candidate is the authorised candidate or, if he is not the authorised candidate of any political party, that he is standing as an independent candidate; (b) be completed in all respects, save that the supporters shall sign it in the presence of the returning officer; (c) be signed by the candidate or by any person authorised in that behalf by him in writing: Provided that if the nomination paper is signed on behalf of the candidate, a copy of the written authority shall be attached thereto; (d) State the name and address of his election agent, if any; (e) be lodged within the period appointed for that purpose in respect of such constituency; (f) be accompanied by an election fee in the sum of twenty thousand kwacha which fee shall not be refunded once the nomination has been lodged; (g) be accompanied by a declaration in Form GEN 3 set out in the Schedule hereto which the declarant has made and subscribed before a magistrate. (4) At the time of lodging a nomination paper, the candidate, or a person duly authorised by him, shall present himself to the returning officer together with his nine supporters who shall produce their voters registration cards and national registration cards to the returning officer. The supporters shall complete that part of the nomination paper which relates to their signatures in the presence of the returning officer.
A5RECPPGTXT: No rules
A37MBRWAIT: No explicit rules set out in the party constitution. The constitution provides for a party electoral committee which 'prepares and proposes' the rules and regulations for party elections in conjunction with the Secretary General, 'for consideration of the National Management Committee'. The electoral committee is responsible for supervising and managing party elections at all levels. The ward, district and constituency committee officials constitute the electoral college for 'electing' candidates. But in reality, they merely select preferred candidates and forward them to the national bodies for ratification and final selection.
A69EXCYOUTH: The President of the party shall be elected by the general assembly every 5 years. The party president shall be elected by secret ballot in accordance with the electoral rules and regulations of the party, as read with this constitution. He or she must be a fully paid up member, a continuous member of the party for at least 18 months, a Zambian of 35 years or above and meets the requirements to be a Republican Presidential candidate.

A4RECPARTYTXT: To be registered, the party:1. must be organised to contest elections;2. must have 300 members aged 18 or over (100 to register to contest local elections or elections in part of the state), or have 1 member of the lower house of parliament or European Parliament, (or have 3 members of a local authority to register to contest local elections); 3. must have a set of rules that provide for a regular meeting of the party and an executive committee elected by the party; 4. must have a name that is not longer than six words and is not excessively similar to an existing party; and 5. must not have an emblem that is excessively similar to that of an existing party or that is offensive or illegal.
